Inés es una mujer de 43 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su bazar y tienda de vestir su historia empezó cuando inicio su negocio con un pequeño capital que le prestó una familiar cercana, decidió ponerse un bazar ponerse un bazar debido a que cerca está ubicada una escuela, su trabajo lo hace sola desde las 06:30 hasta las 22:00, no tiene dificultades, está soltera, tiene un hijo de 16 años estudia en colegio fiscal. 

Su sueño desea terminar la construcción de su vivienda y además tener un local en las calles céntricas de la ciudad. Por eso quiere el préstamo para invertir en su negocio comprando papeleria, cuadernos, ropa etc.
texts.en:
Inés is a 43-year-old woman who has a lot of plans for the coming years to make her stationery store and clothes store thrive.  Her story began when she set up her business with a small amount of capital that she was lent by a close family member.  She decided to set up a stationery store because there is a school nearby.  She carries out her work alone from 6.30am to 10.00pm.  She does not experience any problems, is single, and has a 16-year-old son who is studying in high school.

Inés' dream is to finish building her home and to have business premises in one of the central streets in the city.  She would like this loan to invest in her business, buying stationery, composition books, clothing, etc.

loans.use: to buy stationery, composition books and clothes

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a 37-year-old married man. He has 2 children, ages 6 and 10 years. He describes himself as a hardworking man. He runs a general store where he sells milk, eggs, bread and provides money transaction services (M-pesa) to customers. He has been involved in this business for 6 years.  In addition, Richard raises poultry to increase his income. His business is located in a fast growing area and his primary customers are local residents . He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase milk to sell. His business goal is to run a wholesale retail shop and several M-pesa outlets within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more milk to sell.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
For the last 10 years Daniel has been operating a barber shop in Kikuyu town. He is 33 years old and married to Caroline.They have one child.

Daniel was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is also a KADET client. This will be his first loan. He intends to use the loan amount to purchase  machines for his barber shop.

In future Daniel hopes to diversify his business as he ventures to dairy farming.

loans.use: to purchase machines for his barber shop.

loans.name: Marko,

texts.en:
Marko is a 32-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has 3 children between the ages of 5 and 2 years, and 2 of them go to school. 

Marko runs a roofing poles business and he has been in the business for 5 years. He has 1 employee. Marko heard about Finance Sudan through outreach and promotion done in the market by the officer. He is taking a loan of 4,000 SDG to purchase more roofing poles. In addition to this business, Marko has his house rentals as another source of income. 

In 5 years time, Marko would like to hope for increments in the business size and also have better houses for rent. 

His major challenges include home expenses and the low income rate for constructing a house at the moment. 

Marko says that he is appreciating and giving a lot of thanks for Finance Sudan’s support in South Sudan, and he is requesting them to continue with the program.

loans.use: to purchase more roofing poles.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.es: La Sra. Amparo de 28 años de edad con domicilio en la zona Alto San isidro de propiedad  de los padres tiene la actividad de salón de peinados ubicado en el mismo domicilio, y apertura un nuevo negocio de metalurgia en sociedad con su hermano,  también en el mismo domicilio es por tal razón que solicito un crédito en nuestra institución para la compra de un arco de soldar para el negocio que iniciara ya que también el hermano es cliente nuestro, nuestra clienta es soltera pero tiene un niño de 1 año de edad el cual mantiene ella sola con el apoyo de sus padres cuenta con buen patrimonio ya que ella tiene un vehículo propio, el salón ya esta en funcionamiento mas de dos años, y es la segunda secuencia de su crédito, se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado
texts.en: 28-year-old Amparo lives in Alto San Isidro district, in a house that belongs to her parents.  Her business is a hairdressing salon which is located in her home.  She has also opened a new metal working business, in partnership with her brother, which is also located in her home.  She requested a loan from our institution to buy an arc welder for the business that she is starting as her brother is also a client of ours.  Our client Amparo is single but she has a 1-year-old child who she cares for alone with the support of her parents.  She has good collateral as she owns her own vehicle.  Her salon has been up and running for more than two years and this is her second loan cycle.  She feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support they have given her.

loans.use: to buy an arc welder for her new business

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
For the last four years, Michael has been operating a retail shop in Muchatha, Kiambu town. He is 29 years old and married to Jane.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is also a KADET client. This will be his first loan. He intends to use the loan amount to add a stock of sugar, maize flour, cereals and cooking oil.

In future Michael hopes his business will grow and that he will be able to have a steady income and also build rental houses.

loans.use: to add a stock of sugar, maize flour, cereals and cooking oil.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en: Nga is 37 years old with 2 children who are at school age.  Nga is raising pigs and making tofu. Her business started 12 years ago and creates a good income for her to manage her family life.  Joining in our credit program in 2007, she has used loans for expanding her pig-raising business. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 9,632,000 VND to buy beans as material for a tofu-making process.

loans.use: to buy beans as material for a tofu-making process.

loans.name: Kadii

texts.en:
Kadii is 55 years old and she owns a cereals shop in Mariakani. She is married and a mother of four. She has been selling cereals for the past eighteen years. She also sells tomatoes to supplement her income. Her business is doing great.

This marks her first loan term with KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to purchase maize, beans and cowpeas to sell to her customers. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and repay her loan. 

She hopes to see all her children well educated and comfortable.

loans.use: to purchase maize, beans and cowpeas.

loans.name: Ambrose

texts.en:
Ambrose is 30 years old, single, and owns an agrovet shop where he deals with veterinary medicines for animals. He started this business five years ago and earns a monthly income of about KES 10,000.

He has requested a loan of KES 40,000 to buy medicine for cows and chickens to sell to his customers. The anticipated profits he will use to pay his loan and expand his business.

His dream is to have a big agrovet store. This is his third loan.

loans.use: To purchase medicine for cattle and chickens.

loans.name: Berta

texts.es: Berta, de 61 años, es viuda y una buena mujer que ha vivido mucho en la vida y en su largo trayecto tuvo que asumir grandes retos, como el de criar sola a sus siete hijos, y lograr que sean personas de bien. Ella vive en su casa propia a lado de dos de sus hijos con quienes comparte la alegría de educar a dos de sus nietos. Todos los días, desde muy temprano Berta se levanta y hace sus labores domesticas, al termino empieza con la venta de lubricantes, es ahí  donde espera sus clientes, que en su mayoría son choferes de algún moto taxi o los mismos dueños de los vehículos. Su local esta ubicado en su casa y es ahí en donde trabaja desde hace dos años, y con la ayuda de su hijo quien es el que se encarga de cambiar el aceite. Le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que le permite tener tiempo para hacer algunas otras actividades ya que tiene, además gracias al buen trato logró tener múltiples clientes. En el transcurso de su trabajo aprendió muchas cosas y se hizo de nuevos retos y sueños como el de seguir creciendo y empezar con la venta de vehículos nuevos. Este será el cuarto préstamo con MFP, por tanto está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá más segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas y no dejar mal al grupo tan bueno que le esta dando la oportunidad de poder incrementar su capital de trabajo respaldándola en su banco comunal. Con el monto solicitado 2,800 soles, comprará mas repuestos y lubricantes ya que cada día aumentan más sus clientes y desea tener mas variedad que ofrecer.
texts.en:
61-year-old Berta is a widow.  She is a nice woman who has lived through a lot during her life.  Over the many years, she has had to face great challenges such as caring for her seven children on her own and ensuring that they become upstanding citizens.  Berta lives in her own home together with two of her children, with whom she shares the joy of educating two of her grandchildren.  Every day, Berta gets up very early and does her housework.  When she is finished, she starts selling lubricants to her waiting customers.  Her customers are mainly motorcycle taxi drivers or the vehicles' owners themselves.  Her business premises are located in her home and she has worked there for two years with the help of her son who carries out oil changes.  Berta really enjoys her work as it allows her to have time free to spend on other activities.  Owing to her good customer service, she has managed to gain a number of customers.  Whilst carrying out her work, she has learned many things and found new challenges and dreams such as continuing to grow her business and starting to sell new vehicles.

This will be Berta's fourth loan from MFP and she is happy to know that she will have financial support as this will make her feel more secure in making progress in her work.  For her part, she pledges to make her repayments on time and not let down the group which has been so good in giving her the opportunity to increase her working capital, supporting her through her community bank.  Berta will use her 2,800 soles to buy more spare parts and lubricants as her number of customers grows every day and she would like to have a greater variety of products to offer them.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and lubricants

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Teresa De Jesús tiene 53 años de edad, trabaja como profesora de primaria de una escuela de la localidad, ella tiene 3 hijos en el cual uno de ellos ya trabaja y la apoya en los gastos del hogar, los demás están a su cargo y todavía están estudiando. Teresa De Jesús posee una vivienda en el cual su mayor de sueño es de  realizarle a la vivienda algunas remodelaciones y con el salario que genera no le cubre para realizarlas, es por ello que está solicitando financiamiento para comprar  piedra, piedrín, cemento, hierro, arena entre otros materiales de construcción.
texts.en: Teresa De Jesús is 53 years old. She works as an elementary school teacher in a local school. She has 3 children and one of them is already working and helping with the household expenses. She is still raising the others and they are still in school. Teresa De Jesús has a house and her biggest dream is to do some remodeling and her salary isn't enough to pay for it. That is why she is asking for a loan to buy stone, gravel, cement, iron, and sand, among other construction materials.

loans.use: to buy stone, gravel, cement, iron, sand and other construction materials.

loans.name: Hue

texts.en: Hue is 45 years old and has 2 children who are at school age. She is managing a shop for clothes and textile products. Her business started 18 years ago and creates good income for her family. Joining in our credit program in 2007, she finds it is suitable for her business. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 9,632,000 VND to buy more products to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes and textile products to sell.

loans.name: Chuc

texts.en: Chuc is 43 years old and has 2 children who are at school age. She is managing a pharmacy shop. Her business started 16 years ago and creates stable income. Joining in our credit program in 2007, she has used loans for expanding her shop. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 9,632,000 VND to buy more medicine for her shop.

loans.use: to buy more medicine for her shop.

loans.name: Thai

texts.en:
Thai is forty-seven years old with three grown-up children. She manages a shop selling clothes and textile products. Her business started twenty years ago and gives her family a good income. 

Having joined our credit program in 2007, Thai finds it a good match with her business. Currently, she wants to take a loan of 9,632,000 VND to buy more products.

loans.use: to buy more new designer clothes.

loans.name: Mshikamano Tegeta Group

texts.en:
Mwema, who is in her late forties, is married with four grownup children. She has been running two businesses, selling clothes door to door and working as a food vender for six years now.  She works from 7.00 am to 7.00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the stock of ladies clothes. She also bought a fridge and a gas cooker, and started selling food. She built a frame where she sells her food. She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She wants a loan to buy a motorcycle.  Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Mshikamano Tegeta" which has a total of 18 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en:
Chu is forty-six years old with four grown-up children. She is a farmer, and focuses on raising pigs and growing rice. When she finishes working in the field, she provides a rice-making machine service for the farmers in her village. 

Having joined our credit programme in 2007, she has used her loans to raise pigs. She is asking for this loan of 9,184,000 VND to buy raw rice to meet her customers' demand and also partly for pig food.

loans.use: to buy raw rice to meet her customers' demand and for pig food.

loans.name: Evelin

texts.es: Evelin, de 27 años, es una mujer amable, buena y trabajadora, es conviviente con Rodrigo de 27 años y con quien tiene dos hijos, Brenda de 6 y Rodrigo de 3 años. Juntos viven en una casa alquilada hasta que puedan juntar lo suficiente para poder comprar una casa propia, pero mientras tanto trabaja mucho para poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Evelin, tiene como trabajo el de la venta de ropa. En su cuadra tiene muchos clientes quienes son sus vecinos, amigos y familiares, ella trae de otra ciudad las prendas de mejor calidad, nuevos diseños y sobre todo innovadores, y en su casa se dirigen casi la mayoría de sus clientes, pero cuando no hay ventas sale a buscarlos. Por otro lado trabaja sola y eso le permite tener mejores ganancias. Este trabajo le gusta mucho debido a que le genera buenas ganancias, pero también le exigen mucho en cuanto a calidad y diseño, además no es muy pesado y lo puede hacer en el tiempo disponible que tiene cada día. Espera seguir trabajando así y mas adelante tener una tienda en donde pueda ofertar sus prendas de manera mas cómoda a sus clientes. Este será el tercer préstamo con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez mas en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal por que todos sus integrantes son personas que son responsables y muy solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 2500 soles, comprará  mercadería y así tener nuevos diseños y mas variedad de prendas que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en: Evelin is 27 years old. She is a good, kind and hard working woman. She lives with Rodrigo, 27, with whom she has two children, Brenda, 6 and Rodrigo, 3. They are living together in a rented house until they can get enough money together to buy their own home. Meanwhile, they are working a lot to offer a better quality of life to their family. Evelin works selling clothes. On her bloc she has a lot of customers who are neighbors, friends and relatives. She brings better quality clothes from another city with new and above all innovative designes. Most of her customers go to her house but when she has no sales to goes out to seek them. On the other hand, she works alone and this allows her to have better profit. She really likes this work and it generates good income, but people also demand a lot of quality and design. It is also not very heavy work and she can do it when she has time during the day. She hopes to keep working like this and in the future have a store where she can offer her items in a way that's more comfortable for her customers. this will be her third loan with MFP. She hopes to have your cooperation to continue with her goals. On the other hand, she is one again committed to making her payments, as with the previous loans she had. She also likes being part of a communal bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive. With the amount of 2500 soles that she has asked for, she will buy merchandise and have new designs and more variety of clothing to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy more articles of clothing.

loans.name: Karar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 24-years-old, married and has one child.

Karar has been a tailor since 2007; he makes, repairs, or alters clothing professionally as suits, coats and trousers for men. He has more than four years experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He decided to apply for a $1800 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his workshop. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s life.

loans.use: To pay the annual rent for his workshop.

loans.name: Lam

texts.en: Lam is 28 years old, with two children who are of school age. She is both a farmer and a small businesswoman. Raising pigs and selling scrap products are her main activities. She joined our credit program in 2008, using the loans to buy scrap products for sale. Currently, she requires a loan of 9,184,000 VND to buy food for the pigs.

loans.use: to buy food for her pigs.

loans.name: Germaine

texts.en: Germaine is 41 years old. She has two children, aged one and 12. Germaine has spent seven years selling different items in her boutique; she has requested the loan to add more items to the boutique to sell. She plans to use the profits to renovate the house.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell in the boutique.

loans.name: Bankito San José (Montecristi) Group

texts.es:
Las 9 socias y los 2 socios del Banco Comunal Bankito San José se reúne cada quince días en Los Bajos del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse ya hace tres ciclos y formar este Grupo De Crédito que les ha servido de mucho ya que con los créditos, ellos han mejorado  sus pequeños negocios y su vida en general. Ellos se dedican a diversas actividades tales como cría de animales, comercio en general, entre otras actividades.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Rosa, tiene 51 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tuvo 9 hijos pero dos de  ellos fallecieron, la menor de sus hijos tiene 16 años de edad y estudia en colegio y es quien aun vive con ella. Su esposo ya no trabaja por motivos de salud.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos. Trabaja todos los días de dos a tres horas diarias y los fines de semana todo el día ya que son los días que además de vender cobra lo que deja a crédito. Su mercadería  la compra en Manta o en Guayaquil, tiene muchos clientes ya que son algunos años que  se dedica a esta actividad.

Este crédito es para compra ropa de temporada como: trajes de baño, pantalonetas, camisetas, blusas, etc. ya que tiene varios pedidos. Este es su tercer crédito en el Banco Comunal, es la presidenta del grupo y le gusta por la ayuda que le brinda la institución.
 
Su sueño es tener un carro para realizar sus ventas.

En la foto del grupo está una socia que no se le ve el rostro ya que su hija la cubre, por este motivo se adjuntó una foto pequeña de la señora. Los niños de la foto son hijos de algunas de las socias.
texts.en:
The nine women and two men who make up the Bankito San José community bank meet every two weeks in Los Bajos, in Montecristi canton.  This area is known for its rich, pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts which are well known both at home and abroad.  It is home to the famous Panama hat.

This group decided to get together three loan cycles ago and form a loan group.  It has been very useful to them as they have used their loans to improve their small businesses and their lives in general.  The members are engaged in different business activities including animal raising, general commerce and other activities.

One of the members of this group is Rosa who is 51 years old and married.  She had nine children from her marriage but two of them died.  Her youngest child is 16 years old and in school.  He still lives with her.  Her husband doesn't work for health reasons.

Rosa sells all kinds of clothes.  She makes her sales door to door and also sells from home where some of her customers come to buy.  She works every day, for two or three hours a day.  On weekends she works all day because on those days, in addition to selling, she also collects payment for goods she has left on credit.  She buys her merchandise in Manta or Guayaquil.  She has a lot of customers as she has been in this business for some years.

Rosa will use this loan to buy seasonal clothing such as swimsuits, shorts, t-shirts, blouses etc. as she has several orders.  This is her third loan through her community bank.  She is the group's president and she likes it because of the help that she receives from the institution.

Rosa's dream is to own a car with which to make her sales.

In the group photo, there is a member whose face cannot be seen because her daughter is covering it.  For this reason, we have added a small photo of the lady.  The children in the photo belong to some of the members.

loans.use: to buy swimsuits, shorts, t-shirts, blouses, etc.

loans.name: Doris Elizabeth

texts.es:
Doris tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos de 13 y 8 años de edad los cuales estudian y vive con ellos en el Barrio Lempira, La Esperanza, Intibucá.
Doris tiene un negocio de venta de ropa nueva y calzado desde hace un año. Ella vende camisetas juveniles, pantalones para caballeros y damas, calzado juvenil, ropa para niños en variedad. Inicio este negocio con muy poca mercadería, y con mucho esfuerzo, trabajo y administración ha podido obtener el crecimiento del inventario y ha logrado obtener los ingresos necesarios para el sustento de sus hijos ya que no cuenta con el apoyo del padre de sus hijos. Ella le dedica 9 horas diarias.
Este es su primer préstamo de 12,000 lempiras el cual lo necesita para invertir en comprar mercadería, como calzado juvenil para la venta. 
Su meta es aumentar sus ingresos y poder darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos tanto en el estudio como en el sustento diario.
texts.en:
Doris is 32 years old and single.  She has two children, ages 13 and 8, and they go to school.  She lives with them in the Lempira neighborhood, La Esperanza, Intibucá.

Doris has had a business of selling new clothes and shoes for one year.  She sells t-shirts for young people, pants for men and women, shoes for youths, and a variety of children’s clothes.  She started this business with very little merchandise.  With a great deal of effort, hard work, and administration she has been able to increase her inventory.  She has managed to get the income needed to support her children; she cannot count on support from the father of her children.  She works nine hours a day.

This is her first loan for 12,000 lempiras.  She needs it to buy merchandise to sell like shoes for youths.

Her goal is to increase her income and to be able to give her children a better quality of life and education.

loans.use: to buy adolescents shoes to sell.

loans.name: María Zoila

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Tocte, viven por los alrededores de la parroquia de Jadan en Cuenca, este lugar  se encuentra rodeado de exuberante vegetación, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura, realizan artesanías y  muchos salen diariamente a la ciudad a laborar en diferentes actividades, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña María tiene 55 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 7 hijos quienes son todos mayores de edad y viven independientes, ahora vive con dos nietos quienes le hacen compañía y están estudiando en una escuelita del sector. Su esposo labora en la agricultura, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.

La Señora. María se dedica a la cría de cuyes, cerdos y gallinas que los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica. También labora en la agricultura y lo que produce  es solo para el consumo de su hogar.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 4 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de hierba para sus animales y abono para sus tierras para mejorar sus sembríos. Ella esta pidiendo otro préstamo ya que el anterior le fuè de mucha ayuda para su negocio y para su familia, todos sus pagos los realizó el día indicado por lo cual no a tenido ningun problema.
 
Su meta es criar más animales.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Tocte community bank whose members live on the outskirts of Jadan parish, in Cuenca.  This place is surrounded by lush vegetation.  The locals raise animals, farm, make handicrafts, and many go to the city every day to work in different activities.  They maintain the culture and traditions of their villages.

María is 55 years old.  She is married and has 7 children from her marriage who are all now adults and live independently.  María now lives with her two grandchildren who keep her company and are attending a local elementary school.  Her husband works as a farmer.  They own their own home.

María raises guinea pigs, pigs and hens which she sells when she has financial need to do so.  She also farms and what she produces is for her household's consumption only.

María has been a member of her community bank for four years and she will invest her new loan in buying feed for her animals and fertilizer for her land so that she can improve her crops.  She is requesting another loan because her previous loan was very helpful for her business and her family.  She made all of her repayments on time and didn't experience any problems.

María's goal is to raise more animals.

loans.use: to buy feed and fertilizer

loans.name: María Ana

texts.es:
La Señora María es socia del banco comunal Tocte, viven por los alrededores de la parroquia de Jadan en Cuenca, este  lugar se encuentra rodeado de exuberante vegetación, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura, realizan artesanías y muchos salen diariamente a la ciudad a laborar en diferentes actividades, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña María tiene 39 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 14, 8 y 5 años de edad, su primera hija está estudiando en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos  estudian en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo labora en la albañilería, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad. 

La Señora María pasa la mayor parte de su tiempo al cuidado de su hogar y de sus hijos, como pasa en casa se dedica a la agricultura y cría cuyes y gallinas a los que los vende en algún mercado de la ciudad.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra 4 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de  pollos. Para incrementar su negocio.
 
Su meta es crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Tocte community bank whose members live on the outskirts of Jadan parish, in Cuenca.  This place is surrounded by lush vegetation.  The locals raise animals, farm, make handicrafts, and many of them go into the city every day to work in different activities.  They maintain the culture and traditions of their villages.

María is 39 years old, married, and has three children from her marriage who are 14, 8 and 5 years old.  Her eldest daughter is in high school and her two younger children are attending an elementary school in the town.  Her husband works in the building trade and they own their own home.

María spends most of her time caring for her household and her children.  As she is at home, she also farms and raises guinea pigs and hens which she sells in the markets in the city.

María has been a member of her community bank for four years and she will invest her new loan in buying chickens to increase her business.

María's goal is to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Norma Lucia

texts.es:
La Señora. Norma es socia del banco comunal Tocte, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por la belleza de sus calles, por su estructura arquitectónica que es una  mezcla de lo colonial y lo moderno, la variedad en su gastronomía cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños, su gente es amable y mantienen la cultura de sus padres. 

La Señora Norma tiene 23 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido un niño de 3 años de edad. Su esposo labora en un taller de cielos rasos, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.
 
Ella trabaja como empleada domestica hace 4 meses, labora de lunes a viernes desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 2 de la tarde.  En su casa se dedica a la cría pollos, actividad que la desempeña desde que se ha casado.

Es socia de la banca comunal hace 4 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos.

Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Norma is a member of the Tocte community bank.  She lives in the city of Cuenca.  This city is known for the beauty of its streets, for its architecture which is a mixture of colonial and modern, for its cuisine which pleases the palates of both locals and visitors, and for its friendly people who maintain their parents' culture.

Norma is 23 years old, married, and has a 3-year-old child from her marriage.  Her husband works in a ceiling workshop.  They own their own home.

Norma has been working as a domestic employee for four months.  She works from Monday to Friday, from 8.00am to 2.00pm.  At home she raises chickens, an activity she has been engaged in since she got married.  She has been a member of her community bank for four years and will invest her new loan in buying chickens.  Her goal is to own her own home.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Patricie

texts.en: Patricie is 33 years old. She has been selling different items in a boutique. She has requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as rice, maize flour and sugar. Patricie plans to reinvest the profits she earns into this same business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as rice, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula tiene 49 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos en edad escolar. Vive junto a su familia en el sector Fundo San Miguel una zona rural del distrito de Lambayeque,la zona de encuentra situada a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.
Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 10 años, ella cría sus animales en su domicilio, aprendió esta actividad de sus padres y conoce a la perfección el rubro. Por otro lado cuenta con ingresos adicionales producto de la comercialización  de chicha. Con estas actividades ella trata de apoyar a su esposo y sacar adelante a su familia.
Paula  ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles con los cuales pretende adquirir ganado menor (terneros).  Este negocio  cuenta con competencia  pero también cuenta con un amplio mercado para su comercialización. Con esta inversión Paula espera aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Paula is 49 years old, married, and has four school-age children.  She lives together with her family in Fundo San Miguel sector, a rural area in Lambayeque district which is located half an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

Paula's business is raising and selling animals.  She has been in this business for 10 years.  She raises animals at home.  She learned this business from her parents and knows the business like the back of her hand.  She also makes additional income selling 'chicha' (a traditional, corn-based drink).  Through these business activities she tries to support her husband and provide for her family.

Paula has requested her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 soles.  She plans to acquire livestock (calves).  Paula's business has competition but there is also a large market to sell to.  With this investment, Paula hopes to increase her income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to acquire livestock (calves) to fatten and sell

loans.name: Nhi

texts.en: Nhi, a 43-year-old mother of two children who are of school age, has been operating a small grocery shop in the local market for 13 years, earning a good income for her family. Since joining our program in 2007, she has used loans to expand her shop and is now requesting a new loan for 9,184,000 VND to purchase more products for resale.

loans.use: to buy more products to resell.

loans.name: Issa

texts.en:
Issa is a 55-year-old married man, father of four children. Issa opened a Fish selling shop in 2004, his eight years of experience provided him with customers' trust and support, which helped in improving his business gradually to cover most of his family's expenses.
Issa is a hardworking man, with good reputation, his customer service is the main thing that kept his customers loyal & supporting, in addition to the good quality of products served with special prices.
Issa sells both fresh & frozen sea food, upon customers requests & needs.
Issa's main aim is to help his children finish their higher education, that's why he applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to pay for his children's University fees.
This is Issa's second cycle as Al Majmoua borrower, his first cycle helped a lot in covering most of his children education fees too.
He hopes to make his dream come true to see his children in very high levels.

loans.use: To pay for his children's university fees

loans.name: Mohamad Reda

texts.en:
Mohamad Reda is a 28 year-old married man and father of one child. He works in selling religious clothes & souvenirs, in addition to scout's needs. Two years ago, Mohamad Reda opened his shop, and it has developed alot since he started.
Mohamad Reda is a hardworking man with a very good reputation.  He applied for a youth loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to increase his merchandise with special Holy season's articles and souvenirs.
This is Mohamad Reda's first cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower, and he hopes it affects his business positively.
Mohamad Reda works hard to provide his family a good and healthy living,  That's why he works hard to develop his business as much as he can.

loans.use: To increase his merchandise with special holy articles

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 51-year-old married man and father of 5 children who has been working as a blacksmith for 32 years. Nineteen years ago, Mohamad opened his own shop, an important step forward for improving his social and financial situation.

Mohamad is a hard worker. He is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy a new machine necessary for improving his business, that will make working with iron faster & easier. He has been an Al Majmoua borrower for ten consecutive cycles. All his previous loans helped improve his business, and he has proven to be a borrower in good standing.

Mohamad hopes to keep on improving his business and be capable of covering his family's expenses.

loans.use: To buy a new ironworking machine necessary

loans.name: Sylvend

texts.fr:
Sylvand est né au Rwanda. Il a 48 ans et il est marié avec 5 enfants de 2 à 18 ans, dont 3 enfants sont scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 4 ans de secondaire.

Sylvand est agriculteur. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin de payer la main d'oeuvre pour la récolte des cannes à sucre. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d'accroitre le champs en achetant d'autre champs pour son agriculture de cannes à sucre.
Dans les prochaines années, Sylvand voudrait agarandir son agriculture et etre le distributeur des cannes à sucre dans des usines qui produisent sucre. Avec les profits, il prévoit  de scolariser ses enfants  et améliore le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Sylvand was born in Rwanda. He is 48 years old and he is married with 5 children from 2 to 18 years old, of whom 3 are in school. His level of education is 4 years of secondary school.

Sylvand is a farmer. This is his first loan with ACB. He is going to use his loan in order to pay for the labor for the harvest of sugar cane.

His strategy for the growth of his business is to increase the fields by buying other fields for his sugar cane farming.

In the coming years, Sylvand would like to expand his farming and be the distributor of sugar cane for the factories that produce sugar. With the profits, he plans to pay for his children's schooling and improve the well-being of his family.

loans.use: To pay farmworkers for their help to harvest his sugar cane

loans.name: Manuel Jose

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 40 años de edad, y con el pasar de los años a demostrado que es un buen padre de familia, vive con su esposa y sus tres menores hijos, tienen una casa propia la cual ha sido construida en base a su trabajo, la casa esta ubicada en un caserío rural de nombre “Santa Rosa de Yaranche” perteneciente al distrito de Tambogrande, el mismo que pertenece a la Provincia de Piura, a unas 3 horas del departamento de Lambayeque aproximadamente.

Manuel vive en una zona donde tienen como actividad económica principal la agricultura y la ganadería, actividades que no son ajenas a él ya que cuenta 2.5 has de terreno agrícola en donde de manera continua siembra sus productos que están de acuerdo a la estación. Su terreno esta ubicado a escasos metros de su vivienda por lo que se le hace fácil realizar sus mantenimientos correspondientes, después de haber cosechado sus productos son ofrecidos y vendidos en los mercados ya sea de la zona en la que vive o en todo caso serian sacados a otros mercados mayoristas. Su esposa apoya en el sustento del hogar dedicándose a la venta de aves de corral.

Manuel sabe que es tiempo de hacer producir sus plantaciones de limón por lo que solicita  crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 2000 Nuevos Soles para la compra de abonos que le permitan mantener en buen estado dichos plantaciones, con otra parte del crédito desea comprar materiales de construcción con que le mejorara su vivienda.



Manuel es un Hombre que se caracteriza por ser buen padre de familia, buen esposo y buen vecino por lo que se ha ganado el cariño y aprecio de todos ellos.
texts.en:
As the years have passed Manuel, age 40, has demonstrated himself to be a good father.  He lives with his wife and their three minor children.  They have their own house, which was built from the foundation of his work.  The house is in the rural settlement of Santa Rosa de Yaranche in the Tambogrande district, which belongs to the Piura province.  It is approximately three hours from the Lampayeque department.

Manuel lives in an area where the primary business activities are farming and livestock.  These activities are not unusual for him.  He has 2.5 hectares of farmland where he continually plants his products according to the season.  His land is just a few meters from his home.  Therefore, it is easy to do the corresponding maintenance.  After having harvested his products, they are offered and sold at the markets in the area where he lives.  Or, in any case they will be taken to other wholesale markets.

His wife helps with the support of the household by selling poultry.

Manuel knows that it is time to make his lemon plants produce.  That is why he is requesting a loan for 2,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  He will buy fertilizers, which will allow him to maintain said plants in good condition.  He wishes to use another part of the loan to buy construction materials to improve his house.

Manuel is a man who is known for being a good father, a good husband, and a good neighbor.  He has won the affection and esteem of them all.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to keep his plants in good condition and to buy construction materials to improve his house.

loans.name: Noemi Karina

texts.es:
La Señorita. Noemi es socia del banco comunal Fraternidad Prospera, vive por la parroquia de Tarqui en Cuenca, el centro parroquial de Tarqui es un pequeño conjunto urbano, de traza irregular, con viviendas de adobe, bahareque y techo de teja, que conserva su arquitectura vernácula y tradicional. Su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, a la agricultura y comercio, muchos salen diariamente a la ciudad para laborar en diferentes áreas regresando a sus hogares por la noche.

Ella tiene 19 años,es soltera y vive con sus padres. La casa en la que viven es propia.

La Señorita. Noemi al igual que todos los miembros de su familia se encuentran muy bien en su salud. Ella es comerciante y se dedica a la venta de sombreros, actividad que la desempeña hace 3 años, ha elegido este trabajo porque hay mercado y es un productos que no se daña y deja ganancias. 

El dinero de su crédito anterior lo ha invertido en la compra de sombreros para aumentar su mercadería y este nuevo crédito también lo va a invertir en la compra de sombreros para crecer en el negocio. En el pago de su crédito anterior no ha tenido dificultad por lo que realizo el último pago a la fecha.

La banca comunal le gusta por la facilidad de los créditos y el compañerismo del grupo.
texts.en:
Noemi is a member of the 'Fraternidad Prospera' community bank.  She lives in Tarqui parish, in Cuenca.  The parish center of Tarqui is a small urban area with an irregular appearance.  It has adobe houses, 'bahareque' (daub and wattle) houses and slate roofs.  It conserves its local and traditional architecture.  The locals raise animals, farm and work in commerce.  Many of them go to the city every day to work in different activities, returning home in the evening.

Noemi is 19 years old.  She is single and lives with her parents who own their own home.

Noemi, in common with the other members of her family, enjoys very good health.  She is a saleswoman and sells hats.  She has been in this business for three years.  She chose this line of work because there is a market for it, they are products that don't get damaged and it makes her profits.

Noemi invested the money from her previous loan in buying hats to increase her stock.  She will also invest this loan in buying hats to grow her business.  She didn't experience any difficulties in repaying her previous loan and made her final repayment on time.

Noemi likes her community bank because of the ease of obtaining loans and the friendship amongst the group's members.

loans.use: to buy hats

loans.name: Asem

texts.en:
Asem is a 22-year-old single man who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He has completed secondary school only and describes himself as intelligent and determined with his business. He operates a phone accessories business where he sells mobile phones, covers for mobile phones; chargers and recharge phone cards, etc. He has been involved in this business for two years.

Asem started his business with limited income that he gained from people who employed him. His family was relying on him for help with expenses. His business is located in a competitive area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his business challenge to be insufficient funds to improve his business. 

Asem requested a youth  loan of 80,000 YER from AMB to purchase more items such as chargers, recharge phone cards, and covers for mobile phones to sell. Asem's business goal is to run his own business well and hopefully improve it, as well as to put aside savings for getting married.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as chargers, recharge phone cards, and covers for mobile phones for his business.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mai is 44 years old and has two children who are school age. She is both a farmer and a small-business owner. Raising pigs and selling scrap products are her main activities. Having joined our credit program in 2007, Mai used loans to buy scrap products to sell. Currently, she is requesting a loan of 9,184,000 VND to buy pigs.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Beathe

texts.en:
Beathe is 45 years old. She has five children between the ages of 12 and 20. 

Beathe has a supermarket, which she has been running for the past two years. She says the business has helped her to provide for her family. 

With the loan, Beathe expects to add more products to sell in her supermarket. The profits that will be obtained from the business will be invested in her savings.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell in her supermarket.

loans.name: José Jorge

texts.es:
El Señor. José es socio del banco comunal Fraternidad Prospera, vive por la parroquia de Tarquiv en Cuenca, el centro parroquial de Tarqui es un pequeño conjunto urbano, de traza irregular, con viviendas de adobe, bahareque y techo de teja, que conserva su arquitectura vernácula y tradicional. Su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, a la agricultura y comercio, muchos salen diariamente a la ciudad para laborar en diferentes áreas regresando a sus hogares por la noche.

Don José tiene 62 años, casado y tiene 5 hijos quienes dos son casados y viven independientes, sus dos hijos solteros trabajan y ayudan le ayudan económicamente y su último hijo está estudiando en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposa se dedica al comercio, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.
 
Él labora desde hace 25 años en el área de la construcción como albañil, trabaja de lunes a sábados. También es comerciante de sombreros y en este negocio  labora hace 20 años.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra hace dos años y medio y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de sombreros para continuar con su negocio. 

Su meta es  crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
José is a member of the 'Fraternidad Prospera' community bank.  He lives in Tarqui parish, in Cuenca.  The parish center of Tarqui is a small urban area, with an irregular appearance.  There are adobe houses, 'bahareque' (daub and wattle) houses and slate roofs.  The place maintains its local and traditional architecture.  The local people raise animals, farm and work in commerce.  Many go out to the city every day to work in different activities, returning home at evening.

José is 62 years old, married, and has five children, two of whom are married and live independently.  His two single children work and help out financially, and his youngest child is attending an elementary school in the town.  His wife works in commerce.  They own their own home.

José has been working in the building trade as a builder for 25 years.  He works from Monday to Saturday.  He also sells hats and has been working in this business for 20 years.

José has been a member of his community bank for two and a half years and will invest his new loan in buying hats so that he can continue in his business.  His goal is to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy hats

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 35 years old. She is married to a farmer. She has a tailoring business she has been running for the past six years. 

Christine has requested a loan to buy more fabrics to make clothes for her tailoring business. With the profits, she wants to expand her sewing business to the extent of having a workshop in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fabrics for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Boaz

texts.en:
Boaz is a 30-year-old married man. He has three children, ranging in ages from 1 to 7. He describes himself as a God-fearing man. 

Boaz operates a retail business where he sells eggs and loaves of bread. He has been involved in this business for six years and employs four staff members. His business is located at a viable and strategic area, and his primary customers are local residents. 

Additionally, Boaz sells charcoal to increase his income. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the business. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase eggs and bread to sell. Boaz's business goal is to purchase a container to assist in the delivery of eggs and loaves of bread to customers within five years.

loans.use: to buy more eggs and loaves of bread to sell.

loans.name: Josiane

texts.en: Josiane is 35 years old and married. She has been selling goats for nine months. Josiane is requesting a loan to buy more goats to sell. She plans to use the profits to add to her savings.

loans.use: to purchase more goats to sell.

loans.name: Sonia Beatriz

texts.es:
La Señora. Sonia es socia del banco comunal Fraternidad Prospera, vive por la parroquia de Tarqui en Cuenca, el centro parroquial de Tarqui es un pequeño conjunto urbano, de traza irregular, con viviendas de adobe, bahareque y techo de teja, que conserva su arquitectura vernácula y tradicional. Su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, a la agricultura y comercio, muchos salen diariamente a la ciudad para laborar en diferentes áreas regresando a sus hogares por la noche.

Doña Sonia tiene 31 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 16, 13 y 6 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos están estudiando en el colegio y su ultima hija está estudiando en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo es comerciante, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad. 

La Señora. Sonia al igual que su esposo se dedica al comercio de sombreros, actividad que la desempeñan hace 3 años y trabajan de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo. 

Se encuentra en el banco comunal en su segundo crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de sombreros.
 
Su meta es tener un local propio para vender su mercadería.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the 'Fraternidad Prospera' community bank.  She lives in Tarqui parish, in Cuenca.  The parish center of Tarqui is a small, urban area with an irregular appearance.  It has adobe houses, 'bahareque' (daub and wattle) houses and slate roofs.  It maintains its local and traditional architecture.  The local people raise animals, farm and work in commerce.  Many go to the city every day to work in different activities, returning home at night.

Sonia is 31 years old, married, and has three children from her marriage who are 16, 13 and 6 years old.  Her two eldest children are in high school and her youngest daughter is attending an elementary school in the town.  Her husband is a salesman.  They own their own home.

Sonia and her husband both sell hats.  They have been in this business for three years and work from Sunday to Sunday.  They do not work fixed hours.

Sonia has been a member of her community bank for two loan cycles and she will invest her loan in buying hats.

Sonia's goal is to own her own business premises from which to sell her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy hats

loans.name: Jasiri Group

texts.en:
Victoria is in her early 30s, married, and has three children who attend school.  She has been running two businesses, food vender and vitenge (African traditional fabric) for one year.  She works from 7:00 am to 5:00 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.
 
Victoria is requesting her third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase the vitenge and food stock and has repaid all her loans successfully.  With this loan, she wants to increase her food stock so that she can sell more food.  Her dream is to build her own house.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Jasiri," which has a total of 17 members who hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase her food stock so that she can sell more food.

loans.name: Damas Del Barrio San Antonio Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes del comité son de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras que luchan por sus familias, ya que desean darles un futuro mejor. Fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas, no solo en lo económico, sino también en lo personal. Ellas son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras y unidas.
La Sra. Lucia, presidenta del grupo, es una mujer casada, tiene 6 hijos, es mujer muy activa  y nos cuenta que siempre se esfuerza para poder ayudar a sus compañeras de grupo.  Ella cuenta que se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, en lo cual le va muy bien, ya que se ha formado ya una buena clientela.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de verduras y frutas, con lo cual podrá estar abastecida para cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The members of this committee are from the city of San Lorenzo.  They are very hard-working and entrepreneurial women who work hard for their families as they would like to provide them with a better future.  They have set their main goal as being the growth of every one of them, not only from a financial point of view but also in their personal lives.  The women are well known in their area as being very hard-working and united.

Lucia is the president of the group.  She is a married woman and has six children.  She is very active and tells us that she always works hard so that she can help her fellow group members.  She says that her business is selling fruit and vegetables and it is doing very well.  She has already gained a good customer base.

Lucia is requesting this loan to buy fruit and vegetables so that she can stock her business and fill her customers' orders.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is thirty-two years old. She lives in Gardabani District, East Georgia with her family: her husband Lashar and her parents-in-law. The main source of the income for the family is agriculture. They have a small dairy farm. The family sells milk to local dairy product retailers. Along with the dairy, the family earns money through selling brooms. All family members make brooms at home and sell them on local open market. The total average monthly income of the family is 1200 Laris. 

Jamila requested credit to purchase two milk cows. The family will get more milk and their income from milk sales will increase. It will allow them to purchase more household goods and gradually improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase milk cows.

loans.name: Nugzar

texts.en:
Nugzar is 51 years old. He lives in the village Kvirike, Seaside of Georgia. He is married and lives with his family: wife Tamar and three children (24, 23 and 22 years old). 

Nugzar earns a living through trade with green-grocery products. He purchases green-grocery products on the wholesale markets and takes them with his own minibus to nearby villages. Along with trade, Nugzar is involved in the family's agribusiness. They have a milk cow and sell homemade cheese. The family also grows citrus and nut trees on 0.25 hectare land. Nugzar sells harvested products from his minibus as well. Total average monthly income of the family is 500 Laris. 

Nugzar requested credit for purchasing additional green-grocery products for resale. With the new products, he will increase sales and the income of the family will increase. The family will be able to spend more on satisfying their daily needs to improve living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Neli

texts.en:
Neli is 63 years old. She lives in the village of Pshaveli in East Georgia. She lives with her husband George. Both of them are retired and get monthly pensions. According to the Credo estimation, the family belongs to the "vulnerable poor" category. Neli and George requested credit from Kiva in order to start an agricultural business in order to get income. 

They plan to purchase a calf. It will be grown and turned into a milk cow. The family will get milk and produce cheese for sale. A small part of the credit will be used for cultivation of the family-owned plot of land, where maize will be grown. Part of the harvested maize will be used for feeding the cow and the second part will be sold at the local market.

At the moment, the average monthly income of the family is 190 Laris (pensions). After a couple of months, when the cow starts milking, the income of the family will double. They will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a calf

loans.name: Temur

texts.en:
Temur is 33 years old and is a shepherd from the village of Jughaani in East Georgia. He lives with his family- his wife Mzia, their two sons (two and four years old), his mother, and his grandmother. Temur is the only income provider in the family. Mzia is a housewife. His mother has health problems and gets a pension from the government. The total average monthly income of the family is 470 Laris (Temur’s salary and his mother and grandmother’s pensions). According to Credo estimations, Temur’s family belongs to the "vulnerable poor" category.

Temur decided to start up an agricultural business. He requested credit from Kiva for purchasing calves. He will grow calves and sell them in the summer for a higher price. It will give additional income to the family, and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Amiran

texts.en:
Amiran is 55 years old. He lives in a small village in Akhmeta district, East Georgia.  Amiran is married and lives with his wife Nina. Amiran works as a taxi driver in his district. Nina is a housewife. The total average monthly income for the family is 700 Laris. 

A couple of years ago the family used to run a small dairy farm. But they sold their cows in order to get cash to purchase a taxi, which is the main source of income for them now.  Amiran has requested credit to restart his family farm business. He will purchase calves and raise them. The grown calves will be sold in summer/fall and the family will get additional income.  Amiran plans to invest part of the loan in the farm business and spend some to purchase additional household goods to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: buy cattle

loans.name: Amigas Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina “Amigas ”  están  en el Séptimo  Ciclo con 17 integrantes , es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas, solidarias  y responsables,  ellas tienen actividades diferentes, pero también realizan actividades en conjunto para que de esa forma puedan fomentar su compañerismo.
Disma es una de las miembros, ella nos cuenta que es una mujer muy trabajadora y que se dedica a la venta de prendas de variadas clases, por medio de las ventas ella ha podido salir adelante y ayudar a su familia con los gastos que surgen día a día. Una de sus metas es poder tener un local donde poder ofrecer las prendas que vende y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo y ayudando a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de remeras, pantalones, camisas y demás tipos de prendas para poder surtirse para sus clientes.
texts.en:
This committee is called "Amigas" (Friends) and they are in their seventh loan cycle with 17 members.  This is a group which stands out in their neighborhood for being very united, supportive and responsible.  They all work in different business activities but also carry out activities together in order to boost their team spirit.

Disma is one of the members of this group.  She tells us that she is a very hard-working woman whose business is selling different classes of clothes.  Through her sales, she has been able to make progress and help her family with the expenses that crop up each day.  One of her goals is to own business premises from which to sell her clothes.  In this way she would be able to continue growing and helping her family.

Disma is requesting this loan to buy t-shirts, pants, shirts and other clothing with which to stock her business for her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité La Esperanza nace mediante la gestión y el apoyo de un grupo de mujeres que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar. Este grupo es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo,  son 12 integrantes, quienes fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas en lo personal como laboral.
La Sra. Liza es la presidenta del grupo, tiene 30 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, con mucho ánimo de progreso.  Liza se dedica a las ventas variadas, como ser prendas, zapatos, sabanas y demás, con lo que puede tener los ingresos para poder ayudar a su familia y aportar en la casa. Su meta es poder convertirse en una gran microempresaria.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas, zapatos y demás, con lo que podrá tener una mayor variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The 'La Esperanza' committee was created through the management and support of a group of women who found themselves working in this place.  The group is from the city of San Lorenzo.  There are 12 members who set their main goal as being the growth of each and every one of them both in their work and in their personal lives.

Liza is the group's president.  She is 30 years old and is a very hard-working and entrepreneurial woman who has a great desire to make progress.  Her business is selling various items including clothes, shoes, sheets, etc.  This makes her income so that she can help her family and contribute to the household.  Her goal is to become a great micro-businesswoman.

Liza is requesting this loan to buy clothes, shoes and other items so that she can have a greater variety of goods to offer her customers and keep working.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Temur

texts.en:
Temur is 51 years old and lives in the village of Onoghia, West Georgia with his wife Nina. They are Internally Displaced Persons because of a military conflict which erupted in their country in the 1990's. They earn a living by running a small dairy farm where they make cheese which they sell locally. They earn about 400 Laris a month, including a pension for internally displaced persons which they receive from government. According to our data, this family is in the subsistence poor category. 

Temur is applying for a loan to buy a mini-bus which he will use to distribute bran and flour, products which many villagers use to make bread and feed their farm animals. He will buy these products wholesale from local farms and sell them to local groceries. He has already negotiated the prices these grocery stores will pay him. 

In the future, he would like to diversify his products as a way to increase his family's income and improve its living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a mini-bus which he will use to distribute flour and bran

loans.name: Maguli

texts.en:
Maguli lives in the village Kutiri, West Georgia. She is 51 years old, married, and lives with her husband, Biktor, and her 75-year-old mother-in-law. 

Maguli and Biktor have a small poultry farm. They purchase chicks, raise them and sell them in the village at wholesale prices. The total average monthly income of the family is 310 Laris, including the monthly pension of Maguli’s mother-in-law. According to Credo estimations, Maguli’s family belongs to the subsistence poor.

Maguli requested credit in the frames of the Kiva start-up program for purchasing a car. She will be able to take hens with this car to nearby villages and sell them at retail prices. Even taking into account the cost of transportation (fuel), the profit for the family will significantly increase. The family will be able to increase their spending on family members’ daily needs, in order to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a car for transporting and selling hens.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth tiene 39 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 01  hijo a su cargo. Vive en el caserío San Martin, una zona rural del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona de clima tropical caracterizado por la producción de frutas como el mango y el limón. La zona se encuentra ubicada en la región Piura, a cinco horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.
La actividad que desarrolla es la venta de ropa y productos de primera necesidad. Además cría ganado menor y aves de corral en la parte posterior de su domicilio y los vende cuando ya han alcanzado un desarrollo y peso suficiente, con los ingresos que obtiene de esta actividad trata de sacar adelante a su familia.
Elizabeth desea adquirir mercadería para surtir su bodega y comprar ropa, además de alimentos balanceados para el engorde de ganado y así venderlos a un mejor precio en el mercado local, esta inversión le permitirá seguir creciendo en su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
Ella ya ha tenido créditos con Edpyme Alternativa en el pasado y ha demostrado ser una cliente bastante responsable y puntual con sus pagos.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, age 39, is a single mother and has one child under her care.  She lives in the San Martin settlement, a rural area in the agricultural district of Tambogrande.  The area has a tropical climate, and it is known for its production of fruits like mango and lemon.  The area is in the Piura region, five hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

Her business activity is selling clothes and basic needs products.  She also raises small livestock and poultry in the area behind her house.  She sells them when they have grown sufficiently and weigh enough.  She uses the income that she gets from this business activity to try to get her family ahead.

Elizabeth wishes to get merchandise to stock her grocery store and to buy clothes.  She also wants to buy balanced feed to fatten the livestock.  That way she will sell them for a better price at the local market.  This investment will allow her to continue growing in her business and to improve her quality of life.

In order to achieve her objective she is requesting a loan for 2,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

She has had loans from Edpyme Alternativa in the past, and she has demonstrated herself to be a very responsible client who is punctual with her payments.

loans.use: to purchase a large of quantity of clothing for her shop and poultry feed for her chickens.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Trabajadoras se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres formado en la ciudad de Ita, gracias a que la actual Directora General la Sra. Patricia,contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona, para enterarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y una vez asesorada logró juntar a 12 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 3° ciclo, en forma conjunta.
Patricia es una mujer muy luchadora y nos cuenta que por medio de sus ventas ha podido salir adelante y crecer como microempresaria. Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de toda clase y nos dice que tiene buena salida de sus productos ya que ella siempre trata de tener buena variedad de prendas. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo con su negocio y de esa forma poder seguir ayudando al resto de su familia.
Ella acude a la fundación y a kiva para solicitar la ayuda de estos, para que de esta forma pueda comprar prendas y así poder tener mayor variedad para poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
"Mujeres Trabajadoras" (Hard-Working Women) is the name of this excellent group of women from the city of Ita.  The group was formed thanks to their current director, Patricia, who contacted a loan officer during a weekly meeting that she had in the area in order to find out how the Enterprising Women's Committee program worked.  Once she had gathered information, she managed to get together 12 women who are now working very happily together on their third loan cycle. 

Patricia is a very tenacious woman and she tells us that, through her sales, she has been able to make progress and grow as a micro-businesswoman.  Her business is selling all kinds of clothes and she tells us that her products sell well as she always tries to have a good variety of garments available.  Her goal is to continue growing in her business and thereby continue helping the rest of her family.

Patricia has come to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva to request their help so that she can buy more clothes and thereby have a wider range to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr:
Madame Khady est une femme mariée et mère de 5 enfants à sa charge. Elle est âgée de 46 ans. 
Elle est membre du BV depuis le premier cycle du dit banc villageois
Khady fait du commerce de détail par la vente de poissons séchés , tissus et journaux .
Avec son nouveau crédit de 300000 francs CFA elle va acheter  la marchandise pré cité pour la revendre a ses clients qui se trouvent être les femmes du BV.
Khady nous informe que ses bénéfices lui permettent de soutenir son mari dans  la gestion des besoins familiaux (achat riz huile et fournitures scolaires pour les enfants etc.)
texts.en:
Mrs. Khady is a 46-year-old married woman and mother to five dependent children. She joined the local Banc Villageois upon its very first cycle.

Khady is a retailer of dried fish, fabrics and newspapers. She will use her new loan of 300,000 CFAF to stock up on these items for resale to the women of the Banc Villageois, who are her customers.

The income earned will allow her to help her husband manage the household needs (purchase of rice, oil, school supplies for the children, etc.).

loans.use: to buy dried fish, fabrics and newspapers for resale.

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang is 36 years old and has three children who are school age. She is a butcher. Everyday she sells kilos of fresh pork to local customers.  Hang started her business eight years ago. 

Hang is requesting a loan for 9,184,000 VND, which she will use to buy pigs.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Marie Chantal

texts.en:
Marie Chantal is 30 years old, married to a soldier, and has two children who attend school. She sells foodstuffs, which she has been doing for two years. 

Marie Chantal  is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more foodstuffs to sell. She plans on using the profits from her business to pay school fees for her children. She dreams of having a big business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 28 years old, married to a businessman, and has three children.  She lives in Airport community. She stopped her education in 8th Grade. For the past three years, she has been selling red oil (palm oil) in the market, 

Mary is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business. Her plan is to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Las Pasionarias Group

texts.es:
Las Pasionarias es un grupo formado en la ciudad de San Lorenzo, ellas son todas amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad, y vieron en la fundación paraguaya una gran ayuda para ellas y sus familias. Son personas muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras que se esfuerzan para poder dar a sus familias lo mejor, para evitar que pasen por necesidades.
La Sra. Ana es la presidenta del grupo, tiene 40 años, está casada y tiene 2 hijos. Es una mujer muy emprendedora y capaz de liderar un grupo numeroso como lo es este, durante todos estos ciclos ha demostrado ganas de superación. Nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta en general, ya que tiene una mercería donde vende todo tipo de artículos, como ser prendas, libros, cuadernos, zapatos y demás. Gracias a su negocio ella ha podido salir adelante y ayudar a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de vestir, zapatos, libros, cuadernos, lapices y demás artículos para poder abastecer su local. Agradece por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo de la fundación paraguaya y de kiva.
texts.en:
'Las Pasionarias' is a group which was formed in the city of San Lorenzo.  The group's members are all friends and neighbors from this city who see Fundación Paraguaya as a great help for themselves and their families.  They are very hard-working and entrepreneurial people who work hard to provide their families with the best, so that they don't have to want for anything.

Ana is the group's president.  She is 40 years old, married, and has two children.  She is a very entrepreneurial woman who is capable of leading a large group such as this one.  During all her loan cycles, she has demonstrated a desire to do well.  She tells us that she sells general merchandise.  She has a store where she sells all kinds of items such as clothing, books, exercise books, shoes, etc.  Thanks to her business, she has been able to do well and help her family.

Ana is requesting this loan to buy clothes, shoes, books, exercise books, pencils and other items with which to stock her business.  She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving from Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy clothes, pencils, exercise books and other items

loans.name: Eulogio

texts.es:
El señor Eulogio, tiene ingresos que recibe de la renta cada mes.
El crédito lo requiere para pagar un tratamiento médico el cual no cubre su seguro.
Eulogio es viudo y tiene una hija con la cual vive en una casa en anticretico en la zona de Sopocachi de la ciudad de La  Paz.
Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y la primera vez que trabaja junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Señor Eulogio has income that he receives from rent each month.

He is requesting the loan to pay for medical treatment which his insurance does not cover.

Eulogio is a widower and has one daughter with whom he lives in a paid-for rental in the Sopacachi area of La Paz city.

This is his first time working with IMPRO, and his first time working with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay the cost of medical treatment that's not covered by his insurance.

loans.name: Izkra

texts.es: La socia continua con su negocio de compra y venta de ropa y trae repuestos de autos tambien; La socia continua estudiando turismo y ella misma se mantiene sola. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra y venta de ropa y de repuestos para autos los cuales llevara a la misma comunidad a vender y distrubuir a las tiendas de venta de repuestos para autos.
texts.en:
This member is continuing with her business purchasing and selling clothing, and also auto parts.  The member is continuing to study tourism, and she remains single.

The member is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase and sale of clothing and auto parts, which she brings to her community to sell and distribute to the stores that sell auto parts.

loans.use: to invest in purchasing clothing and auto parts.

loans.name: Desdemona

texts.en:
Desdemona is 65 years old. She is a widow and lives in the village, Tsikhesulori, in West Georgia with her sister-in-law. Desdemona works as a teacher in the village school. Her sister-in-law is retired. The family has a milk cow. The dairy products are mainly consumed by the family members. They sell the surplus in the village. The total average monthly income of the family is 400 Laris, including Desdemona’s sister-in-law's pension. 

Desdemona has requested credit for the start-up of a new business initiative. She will cultivate family-owned land, and purchase fertilizers and watermelon seeds. After proper cultivation and fertilizing of the land, Desdemona will get a high quality harvest and sell it for a convenient price. The income of the family will increase and Desdemona and her sister-in-law will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for land cultivation, and to purchase fertilizers and watermelon seeds

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Madame AWA est née vers 1968, mère de deux enfants, elle vit avec son époux et leurs enfants à Niena dans la région de Sikasso.
AWA, après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès notamment le commerce de pagnes et des parures, s’est vite initiée aux activités de stockage et commercialisation de céréales (mil, maïs, riz, etc.), il y a environ 4 ans. Avec une telle expérience dans ce domaine, elle jouit d’une forte réputation et accueille beaucoup de commandes, mais les ressources nécessaires pour satisfaire ces besoins fait défaut. Ainsi, elle intégra Soro Yiriwaso il y a maintenant 4 ans. Tous les  prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, Awa  sollicite ce nouveau prêt pour acheter, 30 sacs de mil, 1 tonne de maïs et 5 sacs de sorgho. 
Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages de : Finkolo Ganadougou, Farakala et Niena. Les  céréales ainsi achetées sont stockées dans son  magasin à Niena. Ses ventes se font en gros et en détail, au comptant et quelques fois à crédit à une clientèle diverse et variée.    
 Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000 FCFA par mois. Avec ces bénéfices réalisés, elle compte résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses, celles de sa famille, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. AWA was born in 1968. She lives with her husband and two children in Niena, in the region of Sikasso. 

Having attempted several activities without success, including the sale of pagnes (colorful West-African cloth) and jewelry, Awa learned the business of stocking and selling cereals (millet, corn, rice, etc.) about four years ago. Thanks to her experience in this sector, she enjoys a great reputation but lacks the necessary resources to meet customer demand. She decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso four years ago, and all past loans have been correctly repaid. 

Eager to satisfy a growing customer base, Awa is now seeking a new loan to purchase 30 sacks de millet, 1 tonne of corn and 5 sacks of sorghum. She buys her merchandise in the villages of Finkolo Ganadougou, Farakala and Niena.
