64-year-old Magda is a courageous woman who never hesitated in working hard for her children when she was left a widow.  Sadly, she also lost one of her children who left behind three orphans.  Magda raises them as if they were her own children.  They live together in their own home where Magda teaches them good habits every day

Every day Magda goes out to the market very early in the morning.  She goes looking for used clothing which she buys by the bundle and wholesale.  Once she has her products, she catches a vehicle or a boat, depending on where she is headed, and travels to the towns, farms or villages to offer her products for sale.  She sometimes exchanges her products for animals which she then takes back to sell in the city.  She has been in this business for 30 years and it has allowed her to raise and educate her children.  Her work is going very well as she always works as hard as she is able so that she can make enough income to meet her household's financial obligations.  In the future, Magda would like to have a grocery store in her home as she doesn't really enjoy having to travel because it is very heavy going.

This will be Magda's eighth loan from MFP and she hopes to receive your cooperation so that she can continue achieving her goals.  For her part, she pledges once again to make her repayments on time as she has done with her previous loans.  Magda will use the 800 soles that she has requested to buy more used and new clothing.

loans.use: to buy used and new clothing

loans.name: Myasar

texts.en:
Myasar is a conservative person so she is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet. The man in the photo is her son.

Myasar is a 46-year-old married woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan and she is a mother of two children.

Myasar sells blankets and clothes and she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase more quantities to increase her sales volume and her income.

Myasar is looking to improve her family's living conditions and increase their living standard.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and blankets for business purposes

loans.name: Maleeha

texts.en:
Maleeha is a 42-year-old married woman from Al Aqaba, Jordan and a mother of seven children.

Maleeha sells cosmetics and perfumes and she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase more quantities of her products.

Maleeha is looking to expand her business so as to reach nearby areas in addition to ensuring her son's higher education fees.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics and perfumes for business purposes

loans.name: Hind

texts.en:
Hind is a 53-year-old married woman from Al Nasser, Amman, Jordan and a mother of three children.

Hind started her business from home with a small grocery store then she was able to expand the business into a supermarket.

Hind  is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase more goods for the store with an aspiration of improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase goods for her grocery store

loans.name: Vann

texts.en:
Vann is 72 years old, married, and has six adult children.  She has been growing rice for long time. She manages all the farming tasks and maintains the sustainability of living.

Vann owns a few plots of farmland, from which her income is made. She also rents additional farmland from the villagers to increase her rice production during the year. Usually, she grows her rice crops twice a year alongside her husband. 

Vann is requesting a loan from HKL, which she will use  to pay for land she has rented. She hopes that her living conditions will improve though her efforts.

loans.use: to pay for land she has rented for her rice crop.

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en:
Wilfreda is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 
Wilfreda has a retail shop where canned goods, snacks & beverages are bought and sold. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Wilfreda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future,Wilfreda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

loans.name: Juana Alcira

texts.es: La socia continua con su pequeño taller y siguen realizando tallados en madera, la socia esta creciendo economicamente y le esta yendo muy bien, la socia es una mujer muy trabajadora y ella desea el credito para continuar comprando madera suave para hacer los diversos tallados y terminar sus pedidos de cuadros para poner replicas de la escuela cusqueña como lienzos catolicos.
texts.en: This member continues working in her small workshop, carving items from wood. She is growing financially and her business is doing very well. The member is a very hard-working woman and she would like this loan so that she can continue buying soft wood for making her carved products and finish some orders for picture frames which will be used to hold prints from the Cuzco School such as Catholic canvases.

loans.use: to invest in buying soft wood such as maguey

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children.

Eva has a shop that sells bananas by the kilogram. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy more bananas to sell.

Eva has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza, de 42 años, es una mujer fuerte y luchadora, esta separada de su esposo, por lo que tuvo que criar a sus hijos ella sola. El trabajo de Maritza consiste en el corte y confección de prendas de vestir, muchas veces espera a que el cliente venga y le pida un diseño o el remendado de sus prendas. Asimismo ella confecciona nuevos diseños y crea su propia moda. Del mismo modo también se dedica a confeccionar sabanas y cortinas para ser vendidas entre sus clientes. Su taller está ubicado en su casa en donde acondiciono un lugar para trabajar tranquila. Lleva realizando éste negocio por 10 años y con el tiempo aprendió a darle un buen acabado a su trabajo. Le gusta lo que hace pues es independiente, tiene su propio horario y da la oportunidad de trabajar a otras personas ya que contrata cuando tiene demasiados pedidos y no se abastece ella sola. Recuerda mucho cuando se inicio, ya que trabajaba para otra persona y busco su independencia, desde ese momento obtiene mejores ingresos. Espera seguir haciendo su trabajo y mas adelante  tener una taller mas grande con mas maquinas y mas trabajadores. Este será el tercer préstamo con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Esta comprometida con el grupo que conforman los integrantes del banco comunal al que pertenece, además esta convencida que será una buena cliente, puntual y responsable en sus cuotas.
Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará materiales para continuar con su negocio, además comprará algunas herramientas que le hacen falta renovar y así realizar un trabajo de buena calidad.
texts.en:
Maritza, age 42, is a strong and tenacious woman.  She is separated from her husband, so she had to raise her children by herself.

Maria makes clothes.  Many times she waits until the customer comes and asks her for a design or for her to mend their clothes.  She makes new designs and creates her own fashion.  She also makes sheets and curtains to be sold among her customers.  Her shop is in her house, where she fixed up a place to work peacefully.

She has been working in her business for ten years.  In time she learned to put a good finishing on her work.  She likes what she does because she is independent.  She has her own schedule, and it gives her the opportunity to give other people work.  She hires them when she has too many orders, and she cannot fill them alone.

She is very reminiscent of when she started.  She worked for another person, and she was looking to become independent.  From then on she has gotten improved income.  She hopes to continue with her work and to later have a larger shop with more machines and more workers.

This will be her third loan with MFP.  She therefore hopes for you collaboration in order to continue with her objectives.  She is committed to the members who comprise the communal bank that she belongs to.  Also, she is convinced that she will be a good client who is punctual and responsible with her payments.

She will use the requested 2,000 soles to buy materials to continue with her business.  She will also buy some tools that she needs to do good quality work.

loans.use: to buy materials like thread, fabric and sewing tools to facilitate her work.

loans.name: Katherine Nina

texts.es: La socia Katherine  continua con su negocio de compra y venta de artesanía, ella sigue alquilando el mismo local y esta ahorrando para poder tener su propio local, la socia desea invertir en la compra de arte, y de ceramicas, de chullos, mantas, shalws, de lana de alpaca y de oveja. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para realizar artesania y de productos ya hechos.
texts.en: Katherine continues in her business buying and selling handicrafts.  She continues renting the same premises and is saving up to buy her own premises.  She would like to invest in buying art, ceramics, 'chullos' (woolen caps with earflaps), blankets and shawls made from alpaca or sheep's wool.  She is requesting this loan to invest in buying materials for making handicrafts as well as pre-made products.

loans.use: to invest in buying handicrafts, woolen caps, shawls, etc.

loans.name: Chhum

texts.en:
Chhum is 63 years old and lives in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is the mother of four lovely children, one of whom is married and lives separately in a new family. She is completely responsible for the whole family since her husband passed away. She generates a living through rice cultivation, a common business among locals. She has been in this business for many years. 

Her family has need of a vehicle, so Chhum decided to borrow some funds from our lenders to purchase a used motorcycle.  Having a motorcycle will help improve the family-owned business, reduce some of her expenses, and improve her living situation. Chhum is very thankful for the loan given to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle.

loans.name: Ma. Daisy

texts.en:
Ma. Daisy is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has five children.

Ma. Daisy has a shop that sells bananas by the kilogram. She has had this business for 16 years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy stocks of bananas to sell.

Ma. Daisy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.

Juvy has a food shop, or carenderia, that sells barbecue and batchoy. She has had this business for 16 years. She requested a loan of PHP 16,000 to buy raw ingredients for making viands (a traditional Filipino dish).

Juvy has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making viands.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single.

Delia has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 21 years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages to resell.

Delia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to resell.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 63 years old, separated, and has six children. She lives in the Philippines. Salvacion has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for six years. 

Salvacion is requesting a loan for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Salvacion has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Antonia Verónica

texts.es:
Antonia es una mujer de 42 años que vive sola. A pesar de tener hijos, ellos son mayores de edad e independientes. Reside en Santo Domingo que es una de las ciudades más jóvenes del Ecuador, actualmente se ha constituido en el punto de enlace entre las regiones Sierra y Costa del país. Santo Domingo de los Colorados pertenece actualmente a la provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, recientemente conformada en el 2007. 

Antonia trabaja vendiendo comida desde hace cinco años, lo aprendió de unas amigas.  Prepara comida para venderlas en porciones que las ponen en tarrinas desechables. Nos comenta que ella desea invertir comprando una nueva cocina y así ella podría preparar todo al mismo tiempo ya que actualmente lo hace por partes por tener una sola cocina. Ella acudió a Fundación Alternativa por su primer crédito ya que le comentaron que esta institución no solo le ayudaría con el recurso económico sino también que la capacitaría y  asesoraría en su negocio para que de esta manera pueda crecer de una manera sostenible.

Esta emprendedora está muy animada, ya que con esta inversión el preparar los alimentos le tomaría menos tiempo y así podría invertir más horas en las ventas.
texts.en:
Antonia is a 42-year-old woman who lives alone.  In spite of the fact that she has children, they are all adults and live independently.  Antonia lives in Santo Domingo, one of the youngest cities in Ecuador.  It is a meeting place between the coastal and mountainous regions of the country.  Santo Domingo de los Colorados is located in Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas province which was created in 2007. 

Antonia has been selling food for five years.  She learned the business from some friends.  She prepares food which she sells in portions, in disposable tubs.  She says that she would like to invest in buying a new stove so that she can prepare everything at the same time.  She currently cooks in stages because she only has the one stove.  She came to Fundación Alternativa to request her first loan as she says that this institution would not only help her financially but would also train her and advise her in her business so that she can grow it in a sustainable way.

This entrepreneur is very cheerful because this investment means that she will be able to prepare her food in less time and thereby invest more hours in making her sales.

loans.use: to buy another stove for preparing the food that she sells

loans.name: Lorus

texts.en:
Lorus is fifty-two years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with nine children. 

Lorus has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Lorus has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Lorus hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is forty-four years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Mary Ann has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Mary Ann has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Mary Ann hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Daylen

texts.en:
Daylen is thirty-four years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Daylen has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Daylen has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Daylen hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Libia Lorena

texts.es:
Libia tiene 22 años de edad, es madre soltera y cría con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación a su retoño de 6 años de edad, el cual cursa el primer grado de educación primaria, ella vive en la ciudad de imperial, ciudad con extensiones las tierras agrícolas son de primera calidad, las cuales son completadas con aguas permanentes de regadío en donde destacan la presencia de canales de riego que tienen enorme incidencia en la producción y productividad agraria, ella es una mujer muy luchadora a pesar de ser tan joven ella lucha cada día por salir adelante, tal es así que con mucho esfuerzo logro ahorrar gracias a su trabajo en el campo y desde hace 2 años trabaja en la crianza de Patos, ella vende las crías de estos animalitos son muy curiosos y delicados, ella nos comenta que a veces le da pena venderlos porque son muy bonitos.

Libia actualmente está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo ella podrá comprar más aves (patos) para aumentar su criadero, con esta mejora tendrá mas crías para vender y tendrá mayores ingresos y así seguir luchando para cumplir su más grande sueño:” Construir su casa y Hacer de su hija una profesional”.
texts.en:
Libia is 22, a single mother, and is raising her little 6-year-old, through hard work and dedication. Her child is in the first grade of primary school. She lives in Imperial, a city with extensive top quality agricultural land, complete with permanent water for irrigation, which includes the presence of irrigation canals that have an enormous impact on agricultural production and productivity.

She is a very determined woman, in spite of being so young. She strives every day to get ahead. This is so much the case, that she managed to save money, thanks to her farm work and much effort, and has been raising ducks for two years. She sells the ducklings which are very delicate and funny-looking. She tells us that sometimes it makes her sad to sell them, because they are so pretty.

Now Libia is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to their support, she will be able to buy more birds (ducks) to add to her small poultry farm. With this improvement, she will have more ducklings to sell, will earn greater income, and in this way continue striving to fulfill her greatest dream, "To build a house, and have her daughter become a professional."

loans.use: To buy ducks.

loans.name: Milena

texts.es: Milena, de 57 años, es un mujer buena, amable y emprendedora. Está casada con William de 61 años con quien tiene seis hijos que ya son mayores e independientes, juntos viven en su casa propia a lado de su esposo con quien trabaja mucho pues desea poder ahorrar lo suficiente y tener una vejez tranquila. Milena, siempre supo que hay que trabajar mucho para tener una vida cómoda. Es así que empezó a trabajar desde hace 20 años, cuando abrió su pequeña pero muy surtida tienda de abarrotes, con el tiempo amplio su negocio, por lo que decidió vender balones de gas, ya que en la zona no había ningún comercio de éste rubro, permitiéndole obtener buenas ganancias. Mas adelante incursiono en el negocio de vulcanizado de llantas, actividad que lo hace con la ayuda de su esposo quien se encarga, mientras que ella lo administra. Le va muy bien, ya que tiene buenas ventas y muchos clientes, sabe que lo que ha logrado es a base de esfuerzo y mucho sacrificio. Espera seguir progresando, pues tiene muchas metas que cumplir para su futuro y no piensa dejar de trabajar. Este será el crédito número 14 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su negocio, por otro lado ella se compromete una vez mas a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual ya que no desea quedar mal con su grupo. Con el monto solicitado 3000 soles, comprará mas cantidad de productos para su venta de abarrotes, además de balones de gas para tener en stock y comprar materiales y herramientas para el taller de vulcanizado.
texts.en:
57-year-old Milena is a nice, kind, entrepreneurial woman.  She is married to 61-year-old William and the couple have six children who are already grown up and live independently.  Milena lives in her own home together with her husband.  They both work hard as they would like to be able to save up enough to enjoy a peaceful old age.  Milena always knew that she would have to work hard to enjoy a comfortable life.  For this reason, she started working 20 years ago when she opened her small but very well-stocked grocery store.  Over time, she expanded her business and decided to start selling gas canisters because there wasn't a business of this type in her area.  This allowed her to make good profits.  Later on, she also opened a tire repair shop.  This is a business that she carries out with the help of her husband.  Her husband does the work while she runs the business.  It is doing very well as they enjoy good sales and have a lot of customers.  Milena knows that everything she has achieved has been the result of her effort and a lot of sacrifice.  She hopes to continue making progress as she has many goals to achieve in her future and she doesn't plan to stop working.

This will be Milena's 14th loan from MFP.  She is very happy to know that she will have financial support because this will make her feel more secure in making progress in her business.  For her part, she pledges once more to make her loan repayments in a punctual manner so that she doesn't let her group down.  Milena will use the 3,000 soles she has requested to buy a larger quantity of products for her grocery store.  She will also buy gas canisters to have in stock and materials and tools for her tire repair shop.

loans.use: to buy products with which to stock her store and gas canisters.  She will also buy tools for her tire repair shop

loans.name: Danixa

texts.es: La socia continua con su negocio de agregados de construccion, la socia  sigue administrando su negocio, de procesamiento de piedra chancada llamada ormigon, graba y otros, la soica es muy trabajdora y en esta ocasion desea dar como primer pago para su mercaderia de compra de piedras.
texts.en: This member continues in her business selling building aggregates.  She continues running her business processing crushed stone, concrete, gravel, etc.  She is very hard working and on this occasion she would like to like to pay for merchandise, buying stone.

loans.use: to buy stone

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité La Esperanza se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de  Santaní. Ellas formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo. Se pusieron como objetivo poder ayudarse las unas a las unas a las otras y de esa forma poder salir adelante.
Gilda es la presidenta del grupo, nos cuenta que ella se dedica a la cría y venta de animales, como ser de chanchos, gallinas, y otro tipo de animales. Dice que es un trabajo muy sacrificado, ya que siempre debe estar pendiente de sus animales. Su meta es poder tener una granja donde tener un gran numero de animales.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de pollitos para la cría, como así también de alimento para estos. Agradece a la fundación y a Kiva por la oportunidad que le están brindando.
texts.en:
The committee La Esperanza formed with the union of various neighbors of the city of Santaní. They formed a very united group capable of doing activities together that strengthen their companionship. They set as an objective to be able to help one another and in this way be able to succeed.
Gilda is the president of the group. She tells us that she raises and sells animals for a living such as pigs, hens, and other types of animals. She says that it is very sacrificial work, as she must always keep an eye on her animals. Her goal is to be able to have a farm having a great number of animals.
She is requesting a loan in order to buy chicks to raise, as well as food for them. She is thankful to the foundation and to Kiva for the opportunity they are bringing her.

loans.use: to buy chicks to raise and food for them.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is forty-eight years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Merlinda has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Merlinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Merlinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Maria Evelyn

texts.en:
Maria Evelyn is forty-nine years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with four children. 

Maria Evelyn has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She also sells CF Wellness products like coffee and ointment. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy stocks of CF Wellness products.

Maria Evelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Maria Evelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of CF Wellness products.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.
 
Marilou has a shop that sells variety of dried fish per kilogram. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy stock of dried fish to sell.

Marilou has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Marilou hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of dried fish for sell

loans.name: Nenette

texts.en:
Nenette is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Nenette has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Nenette has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Nenette hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Oscar es un emprendedor que se le ha apoyado en el financiamiento para que invierta en variedad de producto para ofrecerles a sus clientes. Este negocio lo emprende de la necesidad de generar ingresos a la familia y apoyar en los gastos. Oscar actualmente está solicitando financiamiento pero esta vez el crédito que está solicitando no es para la el negocio si para realizar remodelaciones para su vivienda. Con el crédito comprara zinc, arena, perlines, cemento, entre otros materiales para la construcción.
texts.en:
Oscar is an entrepreneur who has received financial support to invest in a variety of products to offer his customers. This business was started as a way to generate income for his family and help out with the expenses. 

Oscar is requesting a loan, but this time it’s not for his business, it’s to renovate his home. With the loan he’ll buy zinc, sand, steel panels and cement, among other construction materials.

loans.use: buy zinc, sand, steel panels and cement, among other construction materials.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 12 children. 

Teresita has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Teresita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Teresita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz  is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Ma. Luz  has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Ma. Luz  has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Ma. Luz hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell

loans.name: Vienna May

texts.en:
Vienna May is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Vienna May has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Vienna May has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Vienna May hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.
 
Amelita has a shop that sells fruits like apples and oranges. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy stock of fruits to sell.

Amelita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Amelita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of fruits to sell

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 42 years old, married, and has eight children.  She lives in the Philippines. Marlyn has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. 

Maralyn is requesting a loan for  5,000 PHP, which she will use to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and  beverages  Marlyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Sayda

texts.es: La socia continua ampliando y adecuando su centro de alimentacion de ganados  tiernos y otros aminales que poco a poco los va insertando en su granja, la socia en esta ocasion desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de dos vacas y de pollos.
texts.en: This associate continues expanding and adapting her small cattle feeding centre and, little by little, she’s adding other animals to her farm. On this occasion, the associate wants to invest her loan in the purchase of 2 cows and some chickens.

loans.use: buy 2 cows and some chickens.

loans.name: Israel Moises

texts.es:
Israel es un hombre de 29 años quien vive junto a su esposa Jésica y tres hijos en la parroquia¨"Santa Martha" de Santo Domingo que es cantón y ciudad de la nueva Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, que era parroquia rural de Quito (capital del Ecuador). Es considerado como punto de enlace entre ciudades importantes del país. Es la zona de mayor pluviosidad del país y por ello tiene una gran riqueza hidrológica.

Israel trabaja vendiendo mariscos; empieza su jornada laboral muy temprano en la madrugada y termina a mitad de la tarde. Trabaja con un amigo, de quien aprendió este oficio hace 13 años.

El desea invertir comprando una buena cantidad de mariscos y aprovechar el precio de esta temporada, de esta manera podrá generar mayores ingresos. Es su segundo crédito con Fundación Alternativa, que es la institución que intermediará entre los prestatarios de Kiva a nivel mundial e Israel. En su primer crédito él obtuvo capacitación por parte de esta institución. Nos comenta que le gusta la atención brindada por su oficial de negocios.

El espera que con esta inversión pueda mejorar su calidad de vida. El quisiera tener su negocio de una manera independiente e ir creciendo para ofrecer a su familia una estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Israel is a 29 year-old man who lives together with his wife Jésica and 3 children in the municipality "Santa Martha" of Santo Domingo that is the canton and city of the new Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, which is the rural municipality of Quito (the capital of Ecuador). It is considered a hub between important cities of the country. It is the area of the most rainfall in the country and therefore has a great abundance of water.

Israel works selling seafood; he begins his work day very early in the morning and ends mid-afternoon. He works with a friend, from whom he learned this craft 13 years ago.

He wants to invest in buying a good quantity of seafood and take advantage of the price of this season. This way, he will be able to generate higher income. It is his second loan with Fundación Alternativa, which is the institution that will broker between the lenders of Kiva at a worldwide level and Israel. In his first loan, he obtained training from this institution. He tells us that he enjoys the attention provided by his business official.

He hope that with this investment he is able to improve his quality of life. He wants to have his business in an independent manner and grow in order to offer his family economic stability.

loans.use: to buy seafood to sell.

loans.name: Icle Renam

texts.es:
Icle es un hombre 38 años quien es casado con Letisia con quien tiene 4 hijos. Viven desde hace diez años en la parroquia de "Abraham Calazacón" ubicada en Santo Domingo que es un cantón de la provincia de "Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas" el cual es uno de los más densamente poblados del Ecuador. Tiene un gran atractivo ya que posee varios monumentos distribuidos por toda la ciudad entre el que está el Monumento al Indio Colorado, sector conocido como la “Y del Colorado”.  Santo Domingo es un cantón privilegiado, con gente maravillosa, trabajadora y emprendedora, que lucha incansablemente por el desarrollo y progreso, que recibe al turista siempre con los brazos abiertos y los lleva a conocer lo maravilloso de su cultura y entorno.

Icle trabaja forjando hierro para hacer puertas y ventana desde hace 8 años. Lo aprendió de su antiguo empleo. Su jornada laboral es indefinida, nos comenta que trabaja "todo el día" junto a su esposa. Icle desea invertir en la compra de materia prima, el quiere ampliar su negocio y con este crédito piensa en cumplir con sus objetivos. Confía en Fundación Alternativa, que es la institución intermediaria entre Icle y los prestatarios a nivel mundial. Esta institución le ha dado un buen trato y le brindará asesoría, le gusta la agilidad con la que le han brindado este su primer crédito. 

Su sueño es tener un negocio más grande. Por esta razón ha empezado a ampliarlo. Quiere tener mayores ingresos para poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Icle is a 38-year-old man.  He is married to Letisia and the couple have four children.  They have lived in "Abraham Calazacón" parish, in Santo Domingo, for 10 years.  Santo Domingo is a canton in "Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas" province, one of the most densely populated areas in Ecuador.  It attracts many visitors because there are a number of monuments located around the city, including the 'Monument to the Red Indian', in a sector known as 'Y del Colorado'.  Santo Domingo is a privileged canton and is home to wonderful, hard-working, entrepreneurial people who work tirelessly to get on in life and make progress.  They always receive tourists with open arms and show them how wonderful their culture and environment is.

Icle works in a metal shop, making doors and windows.  He has been in this business for 8 years and learned the trade in a previous job.  His workday is unlimited.  He tells us that he works "all day" together with his wife.  Icle would like to invest in buying raw materials.  He would like to expand his business and plans to use this loan to achieve his goal.  He trusts in Fundación Alternativa which is the intermediary institution that works between lcle and his lenders around the world.  He likes them because of the speed with which they have given him his first loan.

Icle's dream is to have a bigger business.  For this reason, he has started to expand it.  He would like to make more income so that he can provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for his business

loans.name: Julian Alfredo

texts.es:
Julián es un hombre de 65 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su alquiler de lavadoras su historia comenzó cuando la necesidad lo obligo a poner letrero de lavandería así empezó luego se compro 2 lavadoras y ofreció alquilarlas por hora. 

Trabaja solo todos los días, las dificultades son los ladrones y las lluvias porque se dificulta transportarlos, no está casado, no tiene hijos, su sueño es incrementar su negocio comprando mas lavadoras. Por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar más lavadoras.
texts.en:
Julián is a 65-year-old man and he has many aspirations to better his washing machine rental business in the coming years. His story began when necessity obligated him to put up a laundromat sign, and that's how he started. Later he bought two washers and offered to rent them by the hour.

He works alone every day. The difficulties he faces are thieves, and rainfall which makes it difficult to transport the machines. He is not married, he does not have any children, and his dream is to grow his business by buying more washers. This is why he wants the loan to buy more washers.

loans.use: buy washing machines.

loans.name: Carlos Javier

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre de 24 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de bollos (plato tipico del ecuador). 

Su historia empezó ayudándole a su tío en la venta de bollos y después el se independizo, trabaja los fines de semana le ayuda la esposa y sale a recorrer todo el sector de san Eduardo y ahora tiene un puesto en la esquina cerca de su casa, no tiene dificultad, está casado la esposa tiene una tienda, si tiene hijos una niña de 4 años todavía no está en la escuela. 

Su meta es poder hacer su casa de cemento y tener un local para poder atender mejor a sus clientes. Quiere el préstamo para invertir en su venta de bollos comprando verdes y pescados
texts.en:
Carlos is a 24 year old man, and he has aspirations of growing his business selling bollos (an Ecuadorian dish) in the next few years. 

His story began helping his uncle sell bollos, and later he went solo. He works weekends, and his wife helps out.  He leaves to travel all over the San Eduardo area, and now he has a stall on the corner close to his house. He’s not having any troubles. He’s married, and his wife has a store. They have children, including a daughter who’s 4 years old and not yet in school. 

His dream is to be able to have a cement home and a local store in order to better serve his customers. He would like a loan to invest in his bollos selling business, buying vegetables and fish.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fish.

loans.name: Miramar Group

texts.es:
El comite lleva por nombre Miramar, debido a que asi se llama el lugar en donde viven las miembros, han asumido el compromiso de  mantener unido el grupo y trabajar con responsabilidad y por sobre todo ayudarse mutuamente. Actualmente se encuentran en el  noveno ciclo con calificación excelente, integrada por  24 mujeres quienes invierten sus prestamos en sus respectivas actividades.
Una de estas mujeres trabajadoras es la sra. Rosana, quien nos cuenta que se dedica a la elaboracion de todo tipo de artesanias, como ser bordados, y distinto tipo de tejidos. Ella por medio de su sacrificio ha logrado salir adelante y de esa forma ayudar a su familia a tener lo que necesitan para una vida digna y decorosa. Su mets es poder seguir creciendo como microempresaria y tener mayores ingresos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de hilos de lana, cera, aguja, ,remeras, entre otros, los cuales les serán de gran ayuda en su trabajo.
texts.en:
The communal bank is named Miramar, because that is the name the place where members live. They have committed to keep the group together and work responsibly and above all help each other. They are currently in the ninth loan cycle with an excellent rating. The communal bank is comprised of 24 women who invest their loans in their respective business activities.

One of these women workers is Rosana, who tells us that makes all kinds of crafts, such as embroidery and different types of fabrics. Through his sacrifice she has managed to get ahead and thus help her family get what they need for a decent and dignified life. Her dream is to continue growing as a small business and make more income.

She is requesting a loan for the purchase of wool yarn, wax, needle, shirts, among others, which will be of great help in their work.

loans.use: to buy wool yarn, wax, needles, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Maridel

texts.en:
Maridel is a "sari-sari" (variety) store owner from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is 54 years old, married, and has three children. Maridel's husband works as a "habal-habal" (motorcycle taxi) driver.

Maridel sells vinegar, spices, toiletries, and other items at her store. She also sells ready-to-wear clothes to her community. 

Maridel works hard to improve her income and support her husband in providing for their family's needs. She is asking for a loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods and ready-to-wear clothes. Maridel hopes for her business to grow and for her family to experience a progressive life.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods and ready-to-wear clothes

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Arlyn has a shop that sells vegetables like eggplants, cabbages, and radishes. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy stocks of vegetables to sell.

Arlyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Arlyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto es un joven de 24 años de edad y vive con su familia en una comunidad llamada San Carlos, en la segunda provincia de Costa Rica, Alajuela. En una zona donde se ocupa el primer lugar nacional en la producción de café y azúcar de caña. Produce además granos básicos (arroz, frijoles, maíz), frutas, legumbres, tubérculos y hortalizas. Y en esta provincia está ubicado el Aeropuerto Internacional Juan Santamaría, el más importante del país.

Desde hace unos meses que Roberto necesita algún tipo de financiamiento  para comprar  semillas y cultivar en un terreno apto para este tipo de producto, ya que con esta actividad podría tener más ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida. 

Es por eso que Roberto está solicitando un préstamo por el monto de ¢500,000.00 (quinientos mil colones) esto para comprar semillas para lograr cultivar piña, y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. También desea comprar varios insumos para el mantenimiento  de este fruto, asi como fertilizantes y abonos para una excelente cosecha del mismo. 

Roberto es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de El Encanto de Pital y es su primer préstamo, en una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Continuara creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Roberto is a young man of 24, who lives with his family in a community called San Carlos, in Costa Rica's second province, Alajuela.  This is an area that occupies first place in the nation's coffee and sugar cane production. In addition, it produces staple grains (rice, beans, corn), fruit, legumes, tubers, and vegetables. Juan Santamaria International Airport, the country's most important, is located in this province.  

Roberto has been needing some type of loan for a few months, in order to buy seed, and to farm a piece of land suitable for this type of produce. With this type of business, he could have more income, and improve his quality of life. That is why Roberto is applying for a loan in the amount of 500,000 colones to buy seeds, in order to be able to grow pineapple and to provide a better quality of life for his family. 

He also wishes to buy various supplies for maintaining this crop, such as organic and chemical fertilizers, in order to have an excellent harvest. Roberto is a member of the "El Encanto de Pital" communal bank, one of the 150 member organizations of Edesa in Costa Rica, and this is his first loan. 

He will continue growing at the personal and financial level, besides participating actively in his community's credit organization.

loans.use: To buy pineapple seeds and agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Dora Maria

texts.es:
Dora mujer emprendedora, comerciante, madre de familia, casada. Tiene planes a futuro de corto y largo plazo, ir mejorando su nivel de vida mediante la inversión en su negocio. Comercializa productos de consumo alimenticios y variedad, inicio por la falta de trabajo en el país, desde hace años atrás, así logrando establecerse en el ámbito comercial. Tiene su cafetería y Liberia cerca del aria del colegio siendo un factor sumamente importante.  Con este préstamo invertirá en su negocio comprando productos como: gaseosa, golosinas, panes variados, artículos escolares (tijera, cuadernos, lápices, lapiceros, tajadores, papel crepe, lustrillo, cartulinas, fomi, pegas, reglas), también granos básico para elaborar comidas (arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceites, carnes, verduras, frutas), entre otros productos.
Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo con el mejoramiento de su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Dora is an entrepreneurial woman.  She is a business owner, wife and mother.  She has short-term and long-term plans to continue improving her standard of living by investing in her business.  Dora sells food products and a variety of other products.  She started out in her business owing to a lack of jobs in her country some years ago.  She managed to establish herself in the field of commerce.  She has a cafeteria and stationery store near a high school which is an extremely important factor in her success.  She will invest this loan in her business, buying products such as soda, candies, bread and school supplies (scissors, exercise books, pencils, pencil sharpeners, staplers, crepe paper, shiny paper, card, foam, glue, rulers).  She will also buy basic grains for making meals (rice, beans, sugar, oil, meat, vegetables and fruit) and other products.

Dora is grateful to the financial institution for the support that they are giving her to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Carmen Yazmin

texts.es:
La señora Carmen Yazmin es madre soltera y tiene una hija pequeña, actualmente esta vivienda en casa de sus padres. Se dedica los fines de semana a vender ropa usada y nueva afuera de su vivienda, y en la semana es empleada de una maquiladora en aria de producción. 
Solicita un préstamo para invertir en comprar más variedad de mercancía y desea también comprar un quipo para la venta de comida. Ya que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para esta inversión y así tener mas ingreso a su familia y ayudar a sus padres con los gastos familiares, y podrá darle lo necesario para un futuro mejor a su hija. 
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio de venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Carmen Yazmin is a single mother and has a young daughter.  She is currently living in her parents' home.  On weekends, Carmen sells used and new clothing outside her home.  During the week, she works in a cross-border assembly plant in the production field. 

Carmen is requesting this loan to invest in buying a wider range of merchandise.  She would also like to buy equipment for her food sales business.  She does not have the money she needs to make this investment which will make more income for her family, allow her to help her parents with the family expenses, and provide her daughter with what she needs to enjoy a better future.

Carmen plans to repay her loan with the profits that she makes from her clothes sales business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (clothes) and also equipment for her food sales business

loans.name: Jessica Isabel

texts.es:
Jessica es una mujer de 29 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su gabinete de belleza. 

Su historia empezó desde los 13 años estudiaba belleza en academia en las tardes porque en la mañana trabaja en un gabinete en el cual trabajo 9 años, meses después se independizo y ya tiene su propio gabinete hace 6 años, su trabajo lo realiza sola ya que sus clientes quieren que ello les preste el servicio y lo realiza de lunes a sábado de 8:00AM hasta las 6:00PM, sus dificultades son si de pronto se llegara a enfermar, está casada el esposo se dedica a la mecánica automotriz el cual labora con el papa, tiene 3 hijas las cuales dos estudian en escuela fiscal. 

Su sueño es tener su propio gabinete pero en casa que está construyendo y también quiere poner un spaa. Por eso quiere el préstamo para invertir en gabinete.
texts.en:
Jessica is a 29-year-old woman and she has many aspirations to make her beauty salon more prosperous in the coming years.

Her story began when she was 13 years old, studying beauty at the academy in the afternoons because in the morning she worked in a salon. She worked there for 9 years. Months later she became independent, and now she has had her own salon for 6 years. She performs her work alone since her customers want her to provide the service. She carries this out from Monday through Saturday from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m.

Her main difficulty arises should she suddenly become ill. She is married, and her husband is an auto mechanic who works with his father. They have three daughters, two of whom attend public school.

Her dream is to have her own salon but in her home, which is being built, and also she would like to put in a spa. For this reason she wants the loan, to invest in her salon.

loans.use: to buy scissors, dyes, and a hair straightener.

loans.name: Suon

texts.en:
Mrs. Suon is 36 years old and lives together with her husband and two school-age kids in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, where she earns a livelihood by cultivating rice crops, as well as fishing. Mrs. Suon usually grows rice in both seasons of the year on her inherited fertile land. From the two businesses, she is able to earn a suitable income to cover her daily expenses, especially to support the education of her children. 

Now it’s time to start growing her dry-season rice again, yet she doesn’t have enough funds for the process of farming. Consequently, she is seeking a loan from Kiva through HKL to purchase rice seeds, mineral fertilizers, pesticides, and lubricant oil. She hopes to improve this business because she now has enough funds from our lenders.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, mineral fertilizers, pesticides, and lubricant oil.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a married woman with four children aged between 9 and 15. She lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with her family. Maribel has been in the business of raising hogs for more than 10 years. Maribel earns about 4,000 PHP per month with her business.

Maribel is asking for a loan to purchase feed and additional pigs to raise. Maribel hopes to succeed in life. She said she is looking forward to the time that she does not have to borrow money.

loans.use: to purchase feed and additional pigs to raise

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with eight children. 

Carmelita has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Carmelita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Carmelita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
 
Elizabeth has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Elizabeth has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira es socia del Banco Comunal Paraíso, es casada, tiene más de 10 años como socia en Finca Perú, es mecanógrafa, se dedica a realizar tipeos de documentos como solicitudes, cartas, entre otros, gracias Finca Perú logró mejorar su hogar por las charlas que le dan en las capacitaciones, está muy orgullosa por que se compró su terreno en Lima y logró hacer su casa que ahora la alquila, dice que aprendió a ser responsable, puntual y ahorrar, lo que práctica con sus hijas, también está orgullosa por sus hijas que son profesionales.
Su sueño es poner un hotel en el terreno de su casa, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de papel, lapiceros, correctores, resaltador, todo lo que es útiles de escritorio.
texts.en:
Elvira is a member of the Paraíso communal bank and has been a member at Finca Perú for more than 10 years. She is typist and she makes a living typing up documents like applications and letters among other things. 

Thanks to Finca Perú she was able to improve her home through talks given in the trainings. She is very proud to have purchased a plot of land in Lima and being able to build her house, which she now rents. She says that she learned to be responsible, punctual, and to save and she practices this with her daughters. She is also proud of her daughters who are professionals.  

Her dream is to build a hotel on the land where her house is. She will invest the loan she is requesting in purchasing paper, pencils, markers, highlighters and all school supplies.

loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia de 43 años convive con Francisco con quien tiene 3 hijos de 21, 19 y años. Ella y su familia viven juntas en una casa propia en el barrio San Carlos en el distrito de Chanchamayo. Eugenia es una mujer aguerrida y con mucha fuerza. Hace 20 años se dedica a la agricultura con la producción de frutas.
Ella posee 12 cuadras de terrenos de cultivos, en ellos tiene cultivado café y plátanos. Es consciente que el trabajo es muy arduo y requiere de mucha dedicación e inversión, pero el gusta su trabajo, por que todo lo que obtiene es producto de su esfuerzo. El café le otorga ingresos anuales y mientras eso sucede solventa sus gastos diarios con la producción de plátanos. “A la semana recojo 30 jabas de plátanos. Cada una la vendo a 10 soles”, comenta. De sus parcelas de café obtiene 200 sacos de café, cada uno de ellos de 60 kilos. Es así que obtiene de 600 a 800 soles por cada saco, dependiendo del precio por temporadas. Su esposo e hijos mayores la apoyan en el trabajo, pero cuando las faenas son mayores recurre al contrato de personal operario. Desea ampliar sus sembríos de café, para ello comprará otros terrenos fuera de la ciudad. Sería la primera vez que Eugenia obtendría un préstamo de MFP, por eso da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Se siente entusiasmada de pertenecer al banco comunal “San Carlos”. De recibir el dinero lo invertirá en la compra de varias bolsas de abonos orgánicos para 7 parcelas de terrenos de cultivos de café.
texts.en:
Eugenia is 43, and lives with her partner Francisco. They have three children, ages 21 and 19. She and her family live together in their own house, in the San Carlos neighborhood in Chanchamayo district. Eugenia is a tireless and strong-willed woman.  

She has been farming for 20 years, and grows fruit. She has twelve plots of crop land, where she grows coffee and bananas. She is aware that the work is very hard, and requires a great deal of dedication and investment, but she likes the work, because everything she gets is the product of her efforts. 

The coffee provides her with annual income, and in the meantime, she pays for her daily expenses by growing bananas. "I harvest 30 crates of bananas every week. I sell each one for ten soles," she says. She gets 200 sacks of coffee from her coffee plantation, and each one of them is 60 kilos. This way she gets from 600 to 800 soles for each sack, depending on the seasonal price.

Her husband and older children help her with the work, but when there is more work to do, she resorts to hiring laborers. She wishes to expand her coffee plantings, and for that she will buy other plots of land outside the city.

This would be the first time that Eugenia would get a loan from MFP. That is why she pledges to make her installment payments on time. She feels excited to belong to the "San Carlos" communal bank. When she receives the money, she will use it to buy several sacks of organic fertilizer for seven parcels of coffee-growing land.

loans.use: To buy sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Diomedes

texts.es:
Diómedes de 31 años, está casado con Elva tiene 2 hijos: uno de 12 años y el último de 6 meses de nacido. Ellos viven en una casa propia en la comunidad de Yanapuquio en el distrito de Palcamayo, provincia de Tarma. Diómedes se dedica a la agricultura desde que era un niño, ya que nació en la comunidad de Yanapuquio, zona agrícola por excelencia. De esa manera pudo aprender lo necesario para cultivar varios productos, especialmente papas de distintas variedades. “Las papas que más solicita la gente son la Yungay, andina, por eso siembro más esas variedades”, manifiesta.
Su producción ha ido creciendo y aumentando conforme pasaron los años. Gracias a la ayuda que MFP le brindó, ahora cosecha de 6 a 7 camionadas de papas, las que negocia con inteligencia en el mercado mayorista de Tarma.
Diómedes pasó por muchas pruebas en su vida, últimamente sufrió un accidente que dificultó el normal desarrollo de sus actividades, pero ahora se recupera con fuerza por que, lo que mas le gusta hacer es cuidar de sus cultivos. Ahora empezará con una siembra intensa de papas, para ser cosechadas en julio. Gracias a su ayuda, él podría acceder a su crédito número 14 de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Su banco comunal se denomina “Zona Semillera de Yanapuquio”, y sus integrantes son responsables y de visión emprendedora. Invertirá el dinero de su préstamo para completar el presupuesto que requiere para comprar bolsas de abonos naturales para sus 40 sacos de semillas que sembrará en pocas semanas.
texts.en: Diómedes is 31 years old and married to his wife, Elva.  He has 2 children, one is 12 years old and the latest is a 6 month old newborn.  They live in their own home in the Yanapuquio community in the district of Palcamayo, of the Tarma province.  Diómedes has been a farmer since he was a boy, since he was born in Yanapuquio, which is an excellent agricultural zone.  Because of this, he learned what is necessary to cultivate different products, especially potatoes of different varieties.  “The potatoes that most people ask for are the Yungay and Andina, and that’s why I plant more of these varieties,” he asserts.  His production has grown as the years pass.  Thanks to the help of MFP, now he sows 6 to 7 truckloads of potatoes, which he intelligently negotiates in the main market of Tarma.  Diómedes has passed many hardships in his life; recently he suffered from an accident, which made his normal activities more difficult, but now he has recovered his strength because what he most loves to do is take care of his crops.  Now he will start an intense planting of potatoes to be harvested in July.  Thanks to your help, he will be able to access his 14th loan with MFP.  He promises to be punctual in his monthly payments.  His communal bank is called “Zona Semillera de Yanapuquio” and the members are responsible and have entrepreneurial vision.  He will invest the money from the loan in buying bags of natural fertilizers for his 40 sacks of seeds to be planted in a few weeks.

loans.use: buy bags of natural fertilizer.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es: Eugenia es una mujer humilde y alegre de 47 años, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Prudencio de 64 años y sus 07 queridos hijos a quienes desea ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida. Hace más de 30 años que Eugenia  empezó a trabajar en los campos de cultivo. Con la ayuda de su esposo labran la tierra de su propia chacra donde  cultivan plantas de café. Ella siempre es cuidadosa con la siembra que con tanto esfuerzo logró conseguir. En tiempos de cosecha, cuenta con el apoyo de jornaleros  que saben como cosechar el café,  de esa forma llegan a extraer rápido sus frutos; después hace su secado de los granos de café para que pueda llevar a vender a las sociedades acopiadoras de la localidad de Palmapampa, donde recibe buenas ganancias por cada Kilo de de su producto. Mas adelante desea comprar un terreno para sembrar mas plantas de café que le ayudan en los gastos económicos de su hogar y en los estudios de sus hijos. Este será su crédito número 04 con MFP por el cual asegura cumplir puntualmente con sus respectivos pagos, además se siente a gusto con su banco comunal, ya que todos se apoyan entre sí. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, podrá comprar sacos de abono para realizar el mantenimiento de sus sembríos.
texts.en: Eugenia is a humble and cheerful 47 year old woman. She lives in her own home with her husband Prudencio, who is 64, and their 7 beloved children, to whom they want to offer a better quality of life. More that 30 years ago, Eugenia started to work in the fields. With her husband's help, they work the soil of their own field where they plant coffee. She is always careful with the crop that she has obtained with so much hard work. At harvest time, she has the support of laborers who know how to harvest coffee. This way, she picks the beans more quickly. Afterwards, she  dries the coffee beans so that she can bring them to the wholesaler's center where she makes a good profit on each kilo of her product. In the future, she wants to buy land to plant more coffee in order to help with the  household expenses and her children's education. This will be her 4th loan with MFP and she says she will make the payments on time. She is happy in her communal bank, since everyone supports each other. With the 1,000 nuevos soles, she will be able to buy sacks of fertilizer to maintain her crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: María Elena, tiene la edad  de 25 años, está casada,  vive con su  hijo y su esposo que son su mayor prioridad. Ella con el crédito lo que pretende es comprar utensilios para su soda. Ella alquilara un local donde desempeñar su profesión y lleva a cabo el proyecto pensado. Ella tiene como meta con este pequeño negocio generar la mayor de la clientela y tener los mayores ingresos para así mejorar su bienestar familiar y su estabilidad económica.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
María Elena is 25 years old.  She is married and lives with her son and husband who are her main priorities.  She plans to use her loan to buy utensils for her diner business.  She will hire premises for her business and carry out her planned project.  Her goal is to attract a large number of customers with this small business so that she can make more income and thereby improve her family's well-being and financial stability.

This is the first loan that María Elena has received from FUDECOSUR.  She has not received previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR have offered her this loan with better terms and much a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to invest in buying utensils for her diner

location.town: El Ceibo, San Vito, Coto Brus

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a single woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She is in the food vending business. Marissa makes cassava cakes and banana-cue (deep fried bananas coated in caramelized brown sugar). She also sells fried chicken to her community. 

Marissa started her business two years ago. She earns about PHP 2,000 per month. Marissa works hard to improve her income. She asked for a loan to buy flour, sugar, cassava, bananas, and chicken meat. Marissa hopes for this loan to help improve her business. Marissa is also planning to help send her brother and sister to school.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, cassava, bananas, and chicken meat

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es: Raquel, de 25 años, es una joven soltera. Vive en compañía de su Mamá Bertha y su hermana Jackelin, en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de El Tambo. Estudia ingeniería industrial en una universidad reconocida de la zona, le falta un año para terminar su carrera. Desea surgir y progresar por ello trabaja con ahínco. En las mañanas se dedica a trabajar en una empresa del estado, donde le pagan un sueldo mensual. Por las tardes ejerce el negocio familiar. Desde hace 4 años brinda el servicio de lavandería, su madre le enseñó a quitar todo tipo de manchas en las prendas de vestir y de esa manera  lava docenas de ropa que por el tiempo debilitaban su salud, es así que decide comprarse una maquina lavadora. En la actualidad cuenta con 2, y que gracias a este implementó ofrece servicio de lavado y puede ahorrar tiempo, energías y abastecerse más; para seguir ofreciendo su servicio con calidad. Tiene bastante demanda de su servicio de lavado por lo que le es muy necesario tener otra maquina lavadora, que piensa comprar más adelante. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “porvenir 2 de mayo” y este es el onceavo crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Raquel de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de anaqueles y materiales para remodelar su espacio de trabajo.
texts.en:
Raquel, age 25, is a young single woman. She lives with her mother Bertha and her sister Jackelin in their own house, which is in the town of El Tambo. She studies industrial engineering at a recognized university in the area, and she has one year left to complete her degree. She wants to rise up and make progress, so she works very hard.

In the mornings Raquel works at a state-owned company, where they pay her a monthly salary. In the afternoons she works in the family business. For four years she has offered laundry services; her mother taught her to remove all kinds of stains from clothing, so she washed dozens of items and with time the work affected her health. This is how she decided to buy a washing machine. She now has two, and thanks to these appliances she offers laundry services and can save time, energy and can stock up more to continue offering high-quality service.There is enough demand for her laundry service that she really needs to have another washing machine, and she is thinking about buying one in the future.

Raquel belongs to the “Porvenir 2 de mayo” (The Future of May 2) communal bank, and this is her eleventh loan with MFP, so she hopes for your collaboration to help her continue with her goals. In turn, she promises to make her payments. She is also grateful to be part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible and have strong ties to each other. If Raquel receives your support, she will invest the money in buying shelves and materials to remodel her work space.

loans.use: to buy shelves and materials.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes es una joven madre soltera de 29 años de edad, la cual saca adelante con mucho esfuerzo a su hija de 12 años que actualmente cursa el primer grado de educación secundaria y por la cual daría la vida con tal de verla feliz.

Con mucha dedicación y sacrificio Lourdes logro tener su negocio de venta de ropa, desde hace 2 años, ella es muy conocida por los pobladores de su barrio, tal es asi que siempre tienen pedidos de prendas para niños y adultos, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy carismática y porque siempre tiene novedades para sus clientes.

Lourdes agradece mucho a los prestatarios Kiva porque gracias al apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar más mercadería, en especial de temporada de verano, con ello podrá tener más variedad de productos para ofrecer y podrán aumentar sus ingresos, para así seguir luchando y poder realizar su gran sueño:”Darle la profesión de ingeniería Civil a su hija y tener un local en el centro de su ciudad”.
texts.en:
Lourdes is 29, and a young single mother who is raising her 12-year-old daughter with much effort. Currently her daughter is in the first year of secondary education, and she would give her life to see her be happy. 

With much dedication and sacrifice, Lourdes has for two years managed to have a business selling clothing. She is very well-known by the people living in her neighborhood, so much so, that they give her orders for children's and adult's clothing. She thinks it's going well with her business, because she is very out-going, and because she always has new styles for her customers. 

Lourdes is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to the support they have offered her, she will be able to buy more merchandise, especially for the summer season. This way, she will be able to have a greater variety of products to sell, and be able to increase her income, and keep striving to realize her great dream: "To give her daughter the opportunity to become a professional, a civil engineer; and for herself, to have a shop in the center of the city."

loans.use: To buy summer clothing to sell.

loans.name: Maria Auxilio

texts.es: María es una mujer de 52 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de comidas su historia comenzó hace 4 años cuando un familiar le regalo un capital para trabajar y de ahí continuo trabajando actualmente trabaja con D-MIRO, trabaja solo todos los días de las 6de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche por las noches la venta de comida, no tiene dificultades, no está casada, tiene 2 hijos y estudian en la escuela fiscal, su sueño es incrementar su negocio y tener un asadero amplio y que sus hijos hayan realizado sus estudios. Por eso quiere el préstamo para invertir en su tienda y venta de comida.
texts.en: María is a 52-year-old woman who has many aspirations for the coming years in terms of helping her food business to prosper.  Her story began four years ago when a family member gave her some capital with which to work.  She continues working and works together with D-MIRO.  She works alone every day of the week, from 6.00am to 10.00pm.  In the evenings she sells food.  She does not experience any problems.  María is not married.  She has two children who attend school.  Her dream is to increase her business and to have a large rotisserie business.  She would also like to see her children complete their studies.  For this reason, she would like a loan to invest in her store and her food sales business.

loans.use: to buy products for her food store and her fast food business

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Ligaya has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 10,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Ligaya has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Ligaya hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell

loans.name: Esmaelita

texts.en:
Esmaelita is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Esmaelita has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Esmaelita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Esmaelita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for sell

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
46-year-old Martina is a sari-sari (variety) store owner from Trinidad, Bohol. She is married and has seven children aged between 10 and 23 years. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Martina has had her store for ten years. She sells items like powdered juice, toiletries, and snacks. She also supports her husband's fishing by selling his catch at the market. Martina does her best to support her family. She asked for a loan to buy fishing nets and more items to sell such as canned goods, instant noodles, and snacks.

In the future, Martina hopes for her family to have a better quality of life and for her children to finish college and find jobs.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and more items to sell such as canned goods, instant noodles, and snacks.

loans.name: Jerry Alberto

texts.es: Jeery es un joven estudiante de la carrera de Ingeniería Civil, está solicitando el crédito para pagar el curso de finalización de estudios. El trabaja actualmente como Ingeniero Residente en una fundación. La mayor inspiración que Jerry tiene son sus padres, porque a pesar de todas las dificultades han hecho un esfuerzo muy grande por salir adelante y darle una carrera profesional. Espera llegar a ser un profesional responsable y capaz de realizar todas las actividades que se le pidan.
texts.en: Jerry is a young student who is pursuing a degree in Civil Engineering.  He is requesting a loan so that he can pay to complete his degree.  He currently works as a resident engineer at a foundation.  Jerry's biggest inspiration is his parents because, in spite of all the difficulties, they have made a very big effort to do well in life and provide him with a professional career.  He hopes to become a responsible professional who is able to carry out all the activities that are asked of him.

loans.use: to pay to complete his degree

loans.name: Massiel Indira

texts.es: Massiel dentro de algunos años se ve ocupando el cargo de contador de una empresa, actividad que será ejercida gracias a sus estudios de contabilidad. El crédito que está solicitando es para pagar el curso para poder finalizar su carrera. Es una persona responsable con mucha dedicación hacia sus estudios y quiere crecer profesionalmente, prueba de eso es haber podido poder costear su carrera universitaria por sus propios medios, contando siempre con el apoyo moral de su mamá.
texts.en: In a few years time, Massiel sees herself working as an accountant in a company.  This is a job she will carry out thanks to her accountancy studies.  Massiel is requesting a loan to pay to complete her degree.  She is a responsible person who is very committed to her studies and wants to grow professionally.  Proof of this lies in the fact that she has been able to pay for her University degree with her own resources, always relying on the moral support of her mom.

loans.use: to pay to complete her degree

loans.name: Ileana Isabel

texts.es: Su mayor sueño en la vida es concluir su carrera con éxito para desempeñarse como una excelente profesional en el futuro y darle un mejor estilo de vida a mi familia, porque quiere darles lo mejor y también una buena educación a su hija. El crédito lo está solicitando para pagar el curso de titulación de su carrera Ingeniería en Sistemas. La situación económica ha sido siempre un problema para ella, pero ha salido adelante poco a poco y ay está en la última etapa de su carrera, y después podrá desempeñarse en su campo laboral.
texts.en: Ileana's biggest dream in life is to successfully complete her degree so that she can work as a great professional in the future and provide her family with a better lifestyle.  She would like to provide her family with the best and provide her daughter with a good education.  Ileana is requesting this loan to pay to complete her degree in Systems Engineering.  Her financial situation has always been a problem but she has gradually managed to make progress and is now in the final stages of her degree course.  When she finishes, she will be able to work in her field.

loans.use: to pay to complete her degree

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de la ciudad de Encarnacion surgió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la fundación, ellas se encuentran en el 14 ciclo, opera con la Fundación desde el año 2008.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Gladys, ella es de profesión modista y se dedica a la confección de prendas para damas en su domicilio.  Cuenta que gracias a la buena calidad de las prendas que hace, ya ha podido formarse una muy buena clientela, que siempre acude hasta ella para darle trabajo. Su meta es poder tener un taller amplio donde pueda emplear a otras personas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos y demás insumos, con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando en su taller. Todas las miembros están muy agradecidas por la ayuda de la fundación.
texts.en:
This group in the city of Encarnación came about through a contact with one of the Foundation members. They are in their 14th loan cycle, and have been  working with the Foundation since 2008. 

One of the members of the group is Gladys. She is a dressmaker by trade, and makes articles of women's clothing in her home. She tells us that thanks to the good quality of the clothing she makes, she has been able to develop a very good clientele, who are always coming to her to give her work. Her goal is to be able to have a spacious workshop, where she can employ other people. 

She is applying for the loan to buy fabric, thread, and other supplies, so that she can continue working in her workshop. All the members are very grateful for the Foundation's help.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, and other materials needed for her workshop.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan  de 54 años  tiene una pequeña fábrica de bollos de maíz; él vive con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades de 18 y 19 años, a quienes sueña con verlos convertidos en profesionales exitosos y él trabaja para ello.  Su actividad inició cuando por tradición familiar, se dedicó a elaborar amasijos de maíz envueltos en hojas y amarrados con pita, para sostener su familia y bien que lo ha logrado,  pues ya tiene un hijo que se perfila como profesional y los otros dos van por ese camino en lo que les gusta. Sus ventas las realiza desde su casa, de contado y a crédito; además de tener un punto comercial en la puerta de un supermercado muy conocido de la ciudad y cercano al sitio de producción Su máxima es que su negocio se fortalezca cada día mas y que sus hijos sean profesionales prestigiosos. Su mayor desafío es el insuficiente capital de trabajo, ante la demanda del mercado que cada día crece, él quiere comprar en mayor volumen para obtener descuentos.
